English: I'll come back later.

English: We're alone here.

English: I'd love to sing for you.
French: J'adorerais chanter pour vous.

English: Which do you prefer, spring or autumn?

English: None of them know French.
French: Aucun d'entre eux ne connaît le français.

English: She can leave tomorrow.

English: He fell for it hook, line, and sinker.

English: Don't eat while reading.
French: Ne mange pas pendant que tu lis.

English: Tom has a Ford.

English: He is inclined to look at everything from the standpoint of its practicality and is neither stingy nor extravagant.
French: Il a tendance à considérer toute chose sous un angle pratique et n'est ni avare ni prodigue.

English: Tom was kissed by Mary.
French: Tom a été embrassé par Mary.

English: I want to cut down on the time it takes to process records.
French: Je veux réduire le temps que prend le traitement des dossiers.

English: Tom will take care of this.

English: This is probably the wrong place.

English: Tom can't work this evening.

English: Will you light the fire?

English: I want you to kiss me.

English: I had loads of fun.

English: Someone has stolen all my money.

English: You knew I was married.

English: I didn't want to leave without saying thank you.

English: This better not happen again.

English: I prefer fish to meat.

English: You should go and help Tom.

English: You must steer clear of that gang.

English: Close your eyes for three minutes.

English: Do you think he made that mistake on purpose?

English: Where did everybody go?

English: He got on the train.

English: It'll take some time to get used to wearing a wig.

English: I haven't used this very much.

English: You know this is illegal, don't you?

English: We're perfectly safe.

English: This is my old bike.

English: We shouldn't resort to violence.

English: I am going to be fourteen.

English: We don't have time to debate.

English: I was chained to the desk all day.

English: You should go.

English: They walked around.

English: You've been selected.

English: She expressed her thanks for the present.
French: Elle a exprimé ses remerciements pour le cadeau.

English: At least they listened to me.

English: He was eager to return to school in September.
French: Il était impatient de retourner à l'école en septembre.

English: This is what I want.

English: You don't want to tell me why, do you?

English: Are you all right?

English: She did not eat anything until she was rescued.

English: Can you please look the other way?

English: Don't just stand there.

English: Don't screw it up!

English: You touched my heart.

English: He likes fishing.

English: I don't think I can help you.

English: I'm sorry you got dragged into this.

English: Don't believe everything that you hear.

English: I think she is good at dancing.

English: He wants to get rid of his books.

English: I need you to go home.

English: I'm not surprised you don't remember.

English: Tom didn't know Mary was dating John.

English: You said you didn't care.

English: We ate together.

English: I'm tired and I want to go home.

English: I noticed him sneak into the room.

English: I thought you might like to know where we'll be going next weekend.
French: Je pensais que vous aimeriez peut-être savoir où nous irons le week-end prochain.

English: I'm the boss.

English: I didn't think we would be so busy today.

English: She takes after her mother.

English: You shouldn't have come here to begin with.

English: What sort of information do you get on the Internet?

English: She blamed her failure on bad luck.
French: Elle a mis son échec sur le compte de la malchance.

English: What would you do if you saw a man from another planet?

English: Did you make this?

English: I come from a family of doctors.

English: Did you hear the news?

English: Everyone agrees.

English: Do you know her?

English: I've got exactly 13 dollars in my pocket.
French: J'ai exactement treize dollars dans ma poche.

English: I wish I could join you.

English: We must've blown a fuse.

English: Unlock the door.

English: I never cry.

English: Tom bought a book.

English: I don't like sweet drinks.
French: Je n'aime pas les boissons sucrées.

English: Let me reiterate what I've said.

English: The diesel engine was invented by Rudolf Diesel.
French: Le moteur diesel a été inventé par Rudolf Diesel.

English: How old are you now?

English: Did you sleep enough last night?

English: Tom fell over and landed flat on his face.
French: Tom est tombé la tête la première.

English: I want more.

English: Be merciful.

English: I can't trust you anymore.

English: I'm not embarrassed at all.

English: You're not easy to find.

English: I can't let you.

English: I want to stay with you.

English: We've already made an offer.

English: Don't waste your time in a dead-end relationship.

English: How's your job going?

English: Sorry, what's your name?

English: Keep away from me.

English: He can't drive.

English: I want to go home and sleep.
French: Je veux aller chez moi et dormir.

English: What do you think of this tie?

English: I almost never make mistakes.

English: Put yourself in my place.

English: We believe in you.

English: I don't think that Tom lied to us.

English: Are you happy about this?

English: Do you eat meat?

English: You can't believe a word of it.

English: Would you say they match?

English: When are you going to get married?

English: It has suddenly gotten cold, hasn't it?

English: He begged me to stay.

English: Tom can do it, can't he?

English: I think that I know you.

English: He speaks Portuguese.

English: I knew I wanted you the moment I saw you.

English: It was an ideal day for walking.
French: C'était un jour idéal pour marcher.

English: When will you be free?

English: She used to enjoy being with him.
French: Elle prenait plaisir à être avec lui.

English: I still think it's weird.

English: Watch out for that man.

English: This is ludicrous.

English: What are you going to tell me now?

English: I live here now.

English: May I go out to play?

English: We have to follow the regulations.

English: He gathered up his things and left.
French: Il a rassemblé ses affaires et est parti.

English: He is afraid to swim.

English: This engine works well.

English: Your lips are blue.

English: I chopped the onions and put them in a casserole with butter and oil.
French: J'ai haché les oignons et les ai mis dans une casserole avec du beurre et de l'huile.

English: You don't seem very sure.

English: I am not rich, nor do I wish to be.

English: I'm not going to do anything about it.

English: Tom is close to thirty.

English: I will sleep at my aunt's.

English: I have been living here for a long time.

English: Your watch gains time.

English: Memorize it.

English: She hit him again and again.

English: Toudaiji is the bigger of the two temples.

English: I was struck by lightning.

English: I couldn't accept the job.

English: I pretended that I didn't see it.

English: I can't tell you the answer to that yet.

English: She got angry.

English: I don't know whether he is dead or alive.

English: Is that supposed to cheer me up?

English: It was a very big room.

English: I don't believe you. You're always telling lies.

French: Mon papy vécut jusqu'à l'âge canonique de quatre-vingt-dix-sept ans.

English: You've been a big help.

English: These three hours of driving have worn me out. Let's stop at the first rest area we see.
French: Ces trois heures au volant m'ont éreinté. Arrêtons-nous à la première aire de repos que nous verrons.

English: Search everyone who comes into this room.

English: I am thinking of my vacation.

English: I don't remember when I did that.

English: I usually eat lunch by myself.

English: I have a lot to learn.

English: Is it possible to talk now?

English: They made the goal.

English: I don't need a loan anymore.

English: Look who's talking.

English: I asked my father to buy this toy.

English: She liked it.

English: There's a book about dancing on the desk.

English: I was as surprised as you.

English: Mozart's life was very short.

English: How early do you go to bed?

French: Ce n'est pas tous les jours qu'on a un immeuble à son nom.

English: He wants to go to the United States.
French: Il veut aller aux États-Unis d'Amérique.

English: I don't see what's wrong with that.

English: He didn't see anything.

English: I know you recently retired.
French: Je sais que vous êtes partie en retraite il y a peu.

English: I like Chinese food.

English: Stop fighting!

English: Let's hope we did the right thing.

English: We know it's important to you.

English: I don't know where I was born.

English: It's the next logical step.

English: I go to the library from time to time.
French: Je vais à la bibliothèque de temps en temps.

English: What do firefighters do when there are no fires?

English: My grandfather was wounded in the war.

English: I knew there was something different about you.
French: Je savais qu'il y avait quelque chose de différent en toi.

English: Do you want to hang with us?

English: I want a lot.

English: Forget about her.

English: Do you have a copy?

English: He did it all out of kindness.
French: Il le fit entièrement par gentillesse.

English: I'm going drinking with some of my friends tonight.
French: Je vais boire un coup avec quelques uns de mes amis ce soir.

English: The rich are not always happy.
French: Les riches ne sont pas toujours heureux.

English: Could you send up some stomach medicine?
French: Pouvez-vous m'envoyer des médicaments pour les maux d'estomac.

English: The students disobeyed their teacher.
French: Les élèves désobéirent à leur instituteur.

English: Take out your notebooks.
French: Sortez vos carnets de notes !

English: Do you think it's dangerous for me to swim across the river?
French: Pensez-vous qu'il soit dangereux, pour moi, de traverser la rivière à la nage ?

English: He won't be home at lunch time.
French: Il ne sera pas à la maison pour l'heure du déjeuner.

English: You must not enter the room.
French: Vous ne devez pas pénétrer dans la pièce.

English: Have a safe journey.

English: We'll paint it.
French: Nous le peindrons.

English: Tom is insecure.
French: Tom est incertain.

English: Are you going to help us or not?
French: Vas-tu oui ou non nous aider ?

English: That's not very good.
French: Ce n'est pas très bon.

English: There is a new survey.
French: Il y a un nouveau sondage.

English: What's the goal?

English: There's nothing fun about that.
French: Il n'y a là rien d'amusant.

English: It's just your imagination.
French: Ce n'est que ton imagination.

English: How many times a minute does the average person blink?
French: Combien de fois par minute une personne moyenne cligne-t-elle des yeux ?

English: It's frightening.
French: Ça fait peur.

English: I'd like to go abroad.
French: J'aimerais me rendre à l'étranger.

English: I want you to help.
French: Je veux que tu aides.

English: This is my letter of resignation.
French: Ceci est ma lettre de démission.

English: I haven't told the kids yet that we're getting divorced.
French: Je n'ai pas encore dit aux enfants que nous sommes en train de divorcer.

English: Tom brought Mary here.
French: Tom amena Marie ici.

English: Tom is playing the violin now.
French: Tom joue du violon maintenant.

English: He is a British citizen, but lives in India.
French: Il est anglais mais vit en Inde.

English: She pushed the door shut.
French: Elle ferma la porte en la poussant.

English: Tom has decided to stay.
French: Tom a décidé de rester.

English: Give me a definite answer.
French: Donnez-moi une réponse définitive.

English: You are responsible for what you do.
French: Vous êtes responsable de ce que vous faites.

English: I bought a new jigsaw puzzle.
French: J'ai acheté un nouveau puzzle.

English: He opened the door.
French: Il ouvrit la porte.

English: I want you to have a job that you love.
French: Je veux que tu aies un boulot que tu adores.

English: The audience began to laugh.
French: Le public commença à rire.

English: Are you tired?
French: Êtes-vous fatigué ?

English: Tom opened a window.
French: Tom ouvrait une fenêtre.

English: I feel your pain.
French: Je compatis à ta douleur.

English: I hate women who say that all men are the same.
French: Je déteste les femmes qui disent que tous les hommes sont les mêmes.

English: I can't fix this.
French: Je n'arrive pas à réparer ceci.

English: Tom was the only one who laughed.
French: Tom fut le seul à rire.

English: Here is your key.
French: Voici votre clé.

English: I agree to your proposal.
French: J'acquiesce à votre proposition.

English: My father visited my uncle in the hospital.
French: Mon père rendit visite à mon oncle à l'hôpital.

English: I have another plan.
French: J'ai un autre plan.

English: Can you give me your phone number?
French: Pouvez-vous me donner votre numéro de téléphone?

English: Who else helped you?
French: Qui d'autre vous a aidé ?

English: Tom overstepped his authority.
French: Tom a outrepassé ses pouvoirs.

English: Several students were absent from school because of colds.
French: Plusieurs élèves se sont absentés de l'école pour cause de rhume.

English: Are you sure they can do this?
French: Êtes-vous sûr qu'elles peuvent faire ça ?

English: I like spring better than fall.
French: Je préfère le printemps à l'automne.

English: All you have to do is to do your best.
French: Tout ce que tu dois faire est de faire de ton mieux.

English: This table is expensive.
French: Cette table est chère.

English: Who am I to second guess him?
French: Qui suis-je pour me montrer plus malin que lui ?

English: How many cars have you owned so far?
French: Combien de voitures as-tu possédé jusqu'à présent ?

English: I couldn't understand a single word of what they said.
French: Je n'ai pas compris un seul mot de ce qu'ils disaient.

English: He denies having done it.
French: Il nie l'avoir fait.

English: Be careful.
French: Soyez prudents !

English: Tom has three mobile phones.
French: Tom a trois téléphones portables.

English: History is replete with the stories of unappreciated genius.
French: L'Histoire est pleine de récits de génies ignorés.

English: Let me do my job.
French: Laisse-moi faire mon boulot !

English: Don't be upset.
French: Ne sois pas contrarié !

English: Do you want to get us both killed?
French: Veux-tu que nous nous fassions tuer tous les deux ?

English: Can you promise me that?
French: Peux-tu me le promettre ?

English: I ignored Tom.
French: J'ai ignoré Tom.

English: I'm sorry I've kept you waiting so long.
French: Excusez-moi de vous avoir fait attendre si longtemps.

English: Go get your passport.
French: Va chercher ton passeport.

English: He went from Tokyo to Osaka by plane.
French: Il voyagea par avion de Tokyo à Osaka.

English: Maybe I'll tell you more later.
French: Je t'en dirai peut-être plus tantôt.

English: I have nothing else to wear.
French: Je n'ai rien d'autre à mettre.

English: Do you want to know where you made your mistake?
French: Veux-tu savoir où tu t'es trompé ?

English: I don't speak French or German.
French: Je ne parle ni français, ni allemand.

English: Sign this.
French: Signe ça.

English: I missed the train. I should have come earlier.
French: J'ai loupé le train. J'aurais dû venir plus tôt.

English: We probably don't have enough money to buy that.
French: Nous n'avons probablement pas assez d'argent pour acheter cela.

English: I suggest that you take a nap.
French: Je te suggère de faire une sieste.

English: Don't forget that she's a woman.
French: N'oubliez pas qu'il s'agit d'une femme !

English: He did it not once, but twice.
French: Il ne l'a pas fait une fois, mais deux.

English: We came by to wish you luck.
French: Nous sommes venus vous souhaiter bonne chance.

English: I never said that.
French: Je n'ai jamais dit cela.

English: Your cat is fat.
French: Ton chat est gras.

English: I was just leaving.
French: Je m'apprêtais à partir.

English: If I'd known that Tom was in the hospital, I'd have visited him.
French: Si j'avais su que Tom était à l'hôpital, je lui aurais rendu visite.

English: I don't fight with Tom as much as I used to.

English: They're all normal.

English: You've hurt me a lot.

English: My younger brother is taller than I am.

English: Tom and Mary went on a shopping spree.

English: I want you to go.

English: You're very sophisticated.

English: He is a friendly person.

English: I told you not to call me on weekends.

English: I just don't want to die.

English: Babies crawl before they walk.

English: Thanks in advance.

English: I built this for you.

English: She cooked the dinner herself.
French: Elle a elle-même cuisiné le déjeuner.

English: Spring is just around the corner.

English: I was convicted.

English: I got up very early this morning.
French: Je me suis levé fort tôt, ce matin.

English: It's already eleven o'clock. I must be leaving now.

English: Since I had a slight fever, I stayed in bed.

English: You don't have to apologize.

English: The heavy rain prevented us from going fishing.

English: Tom promised himself he'd never do that again.

English: This is a difficult time for all of us.

French: Les randonneurs doivent emporter une boussole avec eux pour trouver leur chemin à travers les bois.

English: Stand aside.

English: Take this medicine before each meal.

English: Wherever you go, you'll be welcomed.

English: I want to get married and I want to have kids.

English: Tom seems to have trouble walking.

English: Happiness isn't merely having many possessions.

English: Why is that so funny?

English: She asked him how to turn on the machine.
French: Elle lui a demandé comment mettre la machine en marche.

English: Have you told your mother?

English: Have you ever kissed another guy?

English: That's what I'm always telling Tom.

English: The Royal Shakespeare Company is presenting The Merchant of Venice next week.
French: La Royal Shakespeare Company donne une représentation du Marchand de Venise la semaine prochaine.

English: I thought it was illegal to park here.

English: Neither of us could've done that alone.

English: You'll have to come with us.

English: How old is this place?

English: I haven't finished the translation yet.

English: Why are you so busy all the time?

French: Si tu veux que je joue du piano, je jouerai du piano.

English: Do you eat spaghetti by twirling it around your fork?

English: His explanation doesn't make sense at all.

French: Il est important de disposer d'une sauvegarde hors-site de toutes les données de votre ordinateur.

English: I never meant for any of this to happen.

English: Cancer can be cured easily if it is found in its first phase.
French: Le cancer peut être facilement guéri s'il est détecté dans sa phase initiale.

English: Where's your book? "On the table."
French: « Où se trouve votre livre ? » « Sur la table. »

French: Je me demandais juste comment vous avez pu en arriver à ce sujet.

English: I brought a jacket because it was quite cool this morning.
French: Je pris une veste parce qu'il faisait un peu frais ce matin.

English: I know I'm not dreaming.

English: I think we can trust Tom.

English: Tom needs a bath.

English: They can't hear me either.

English: I don't want to quit this job.

English: The towels are dirty.

English: I thought Tom said it was a dog.

English: I clicked the link, but nothing happened.

English: I think they know us.

English: Is it an action movie?

French: Disposer de quelques piles supplémentaires n'est jamais une mauvaise idée.

English: I don't feel like translating this sentence.

English: Do you want the long version or the short version?

English: I'll never leave you alone again.

French: Elle fut d'accord avec lui sur ce qu'il convenait de faire avec la vieille voiture.

English: I hope Tom and Mary don't get arrested.

English: I'll eat the same thing you do.

English: I became acquainted with your dad yesterday.

English: Tom doesn't have a dad.

English: There's a fine line between bravery and stupidity.
French: La frontière est ténue entre la bravoure et la stupidité.

French: Tom et Mary organisent une fête vendredi soir.

English: She went into the kitchen to see who was there, but there was nobody there.
French: Elle alla à la cuisine pour voir qui s'y trouvait, mais là, il n'y avait personne.

English: I no longer believe that.

English: Are you going to do that anytime soon?

English: Hey, it's not so bad.

English: The cost of living has risen.

English: Tom and Mary often eat dinner together.
French: Tom et Mary dînent souvent ensemble.

English: I just want to be certain that it's OK.

English: The boy caught a large fish.

English: I don't have a curfew.

English: I've got something for you.

English: I'll give you this money.

English: Everyone liked Tom.

English: Is aggression natural, or is it learned?

English: Can you weigh this, please?
French: Pouvez-vous peser cela, s'il vous plait ?

English: Is there anyone in the room?

English: Tom died.

English: Get rid of her.

French: Plus tu manges de chocolat, plus gros tu deviens.

English: Thanks for your help.

English: Don't be fresh with me.

English: You should've seen what Tom did.

English: What he said might be true.

English: I have a package here for you.

English: He inserted the key in the lock.
French: Il introduisit la clef dans la serrure.

English: How do you spend your time?

English: That's a risk you have to take.

English: They saved us.

English: It is to his advantage.

English: I want to see you after lunch.
French: Je veux te voir après déjeuner.

English: Her face beamed with joy.
French: Son visage rayonna de joie.

English: I was wondering if I could take a vacation next week.
French: Je me demandais si je pouvais prendre un congé, la semaine prochaine.

English: What's your most expensive wine?
French: Quel est votre vin le plus cher ?

English: She shook hands with him.
French: Elle lui serra la main.

English: Tom is three years older than you.
French: Tom est trois ans plus vieux que toi.

English: Can you justify the use of violence?
French: Peut-on justifier l'usage de la violence ?

English: Tom is a member of the SWAT team.
French: Tom est un membre de l'équipe du GIGN.

English: The baby weighed seven pounds at birth.
French: Le bébé pesait 7 livres à la naissance.

English: She is coming home at the end of this month.
French: Elle rentre à la maison à la fin du mois.

English: I need to be alone for a while.
French: J'ai besoin de me trouver seule, un moment.

English: You're not the only one with this problem.

English: It's not getting worse.

English: Since we insulated the house we've saved a lot on heating oil.
French: Depuis que nous avons isolé la maison, nous avons beaucoup économisé sur le mazout.

English: I admit that at first I didn't like you.
French: J'admets que je ne vous aimais pas au début.

English: Do you still believe that?

English: Tom found no one in the house.
French: Tom ne trouva personne dans la maison.

English: I can't catch my breath.
French: Je n'arrive pas à reprendre mon souffle.

English: I translated everything Tom wrote into French.
French: J'ai traduit en français tout ce que Tom a écrit.

English: If you don't eat, you die.
French: Si tu ne manges pas, tu meurs.

English: Tom is determined to help Mary.
French: Tom est décidé à aider Mary.

English: They're inside.
French: Ils sont à l'intérieur.

English: I wish he would write more often.
French: Je souhaite qu'il écrive plus souvent.

English: I held on to the rope tightly so I wouldn't fall.
French: Je me suis fermement tenue à la corde pour ne pas tomber.

English: Tom went to the museum with Mary.
French: Tom est allé au musée avec Mary.

English: I had to work hard to keep up with the other students.
French: J'ai dû travailler dur pour suivre le rythme des autres élèves.

English: He was smiling as if nothing had happened to him.
French: Il souriait comme si rien ne lui était arrivé.

English: Tom did everything within his power to save the children that were trapped in the burning building.
French: Tom fit tout ce qu'il put pour sauver les enfants pris au piège dans le bâtiment en flammes.

English: I almost got hit by a car today.
French: J'ai failli me faire renverser par une voiture aujourd'hui.

English: I heard my parents whispering last night.
French: J'ai entendu mes parents chuchoter la nuit dernière.

English: The recent coffee shortage brought about many problems.
French: La récente pénurie de café a donné lieu à un grand nombre de problèmes.

English: That was our plan.
French: C'était notre plan.

English: You should follow your teacher's advice.
French: Vous devriez suivre le conseil de votre professeur.

English: He doesn't like to eat fish.
French: Il n'aime pas le poisson.

English: Don't lose sleep over that.
French: N'en perds pas le sommeil.

English: We must cover the furniture before painting the walls.
French: Il faut protéger les meubles avant de peindre les murs.

English: You made my day.
French: Vous m'avez réjouie.

English: I'm glad to see that you're studying harder than you used to.
French: Je me réjouis de voir que vous étudiez avec davantage d'application que vous ne le faisiez.

English: His appearance deceived me.
French: J'ai été abusé par son apparence.

English: I'm very disappointed in you.
French: Tu me déçois vraiment.

English: Don't be disgusting.
French: Ne sois pas dégoûtante.

English: You promised.

English: He wore glasses.
French: Il portait des lunettes.

English: I played tennis the whole day.
French: J'ai joué au tennis toute la journée.

English: Christmas is rapidly approaching.
French: Noël arrive à grands pas.

English: I don't have a bedtime.
French: Je n'ai pas d'heure pour me coucher.

English: I'll join you there later.
French: Je t'y rejoindrai plus tard.

English: Tom died trying to save a child from a burning building.
French: Tom est mort en essayant de sauver un enfant d'un bâtiment en feu.

English: There was blood everywhere.
French: Il y avait du sang partout.

English: I want to be a guitarist.
French: Je veux être guitariste.

English: You will survive.
French: Tu survivras.

English: Great weather, isn't it?
French: Temps magnifique, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I didn't like my teacher.
French: Je n'ai pas apprécié mon instituteur.

English: I'm glad you could make it.
French: Je suis ravi que vous ayez pu venir.

English: I'm pleased to meet you.
French: Enchanté de faire votre connaissance.

English: My mouth is dry.
French: J'ai la bouche sèche.

English: I'm glad that makes you happy.
French: Je suis contente que ça vous rende heureuses.

English: You have to be prepared for anything.

English: Don't waste your time trying to convince Tom.
French: Ne perds pas ton temps à essayer de convaincre Tom.

English: It's exciting.
French: C’est grisant.

English: I am quite ignorant of their plan.
French: Je ne sais rien de leur plan.

English: It'll probably rain tomorrow.
French: Il va probablement pleuvoir demain.

English: When did you start writing songs?

French: Le capitaine du navire ordonna à l'opérateur radio d'envoyer un signal de détresse.

English: I'm old enough to do that by myself.

English: You've got to stop this.

English: That's something that happens quite often.

English: Tell me what your address is.

English: His intelligence and experience enabled him to deal with the trouble.
French: Son intelligence et son expérience lui permirent de régler le souci.

English: That store closed in 2013.

English: There are many tall buildings in that town.

English: We've got a suspect in custody.

English: I want to be here with you.

English: I went to bed early last night because I was really tired.
French: J’ai été me coucher tôt, hier au soir, car j’étais vraiment fatiguée.

English: Today is our last day of school.
French: Aujourd'hui est notre dernier jour d'école.

English: Tom didn't talk about you.

English: My hair is wet.

English: You're cruel.

English: They are arguing.

English: He asked for the money.

English: You've put on a little weight, haven't you?

English: I eventually want to be fluent in German.

English: Do you think Tom is conceited?

English: He differs from his brother.

French: Vous ne me soutenez pas beaucoup.

English: She agreed to my idea.

English: I'm not afraid to die.

English: Gasoline costs more in France than in the United States.

English: You're not tired, are you?

English: I'll finish it in one hour.

French: « Voulez-vous une autre tasse de café ? » « Non merci. »

English: I thought this was mine.

English: I was trying to talk to you.

French: Un incendie s'est déclaré hier soir et 3 maisons ont entièrement brûlé.

English: I need your advice.

English: Do you want me to sing?

English: Some birds are sitting on the branch of that tree.
French: Des oiseaux sont posés sur la branche de cet arbre.

English: You're so sweet.

English: The theory is too abstract for me.

French: Les amoureux ont échangé de nombreuses lettres.

English: They called for an end to the fighting.
French: Ils appelèrent à mettre fin au combat.

English: I'm not offended.

English: Do you know how to use a computer?

French: Nous avons entendu le garçon jouer du violon.

English: I want to see you first.
French: Je veux vous voir en premier.

French: Mon rêve c'est de voyager dans une navette spatiale.

English: You should work hard.

English: He's really quick.

English: You didn't keep your word.

English: You've won the lottery.
French: Vous avez gagné la loterie.

English: He doesn't come here every day.

English: I must buy some milk.

English: If you don't like this, you don't have to eat it.
French: Si tu n'aimes pas ça, tu n'es pas obligé de le manger.

French: Bien que blessés, ils continuèrent de se battre.

English: What size are these shoes?

English: I want something more.

English: Everybody plays the game of love.

English: I don't feel like it now.
French: Je n'en ai pas envie pour le moment.

English: She's not young, is she?
French: Elle n'est pas jeune, n'est-ce pas ?

English: We have breakfast in the kitchen.
French: Nous prenons notre petit déjeuner à la cuisine.

English: What do you learn at school?
French: Qu'est-ce que tu apprends à l'école ?

English: Are you out of your mind?

English: I'm pretty busy.

English: The cat is watching the fish.
French: Le chat regarde le poisson.

English: That's what scared me.
French: C'est ce qui m'a effrayé.

English: I'm going to need your help on this.
French: Je vais avoir besoin de votre aide pour ceci.

English: What is your destination?

English: I'm already ready.

English: I think you know what I think.
French: Je pense que tu sais ce que je pense.

English: He thinks his job is pointless.
French: Il pense que son emploi est dénué de sens.

English: It was a hot debate.

English: He is Japanese.

English: Perhaps Tom can win.
French: Peut-être Tom peut-il gagner.

English: She was advised by him to listen to her doctor.
French: Il lui a conseillé d'écouter son médecin.

English: The company stopped losing money.
French: La compagnie a arrêté de perdre de l'argent.

English: When was the last time you slept in this room?
French: C'est quand la dernière fois que tu as dormi dans cette chambre ?

English: I had to change the plan.

English: Where is the library?

French: Mon père a réparé ma vieille montre.

English: We missed you.

English: Hot weather will continue, so please watch out for food poisoning.
French: Le temps chaud va persister donc faites attention aux intoxications alimentaires.

English: He took off his clothes.
French: Il a retiré ses vêtements.

English: I got my leg hurt in the accident.
French: Je me suis fait mal à la jambe dans l'accident.

English: I figured I'd find you here.
French: Je me suis imaginée que je te trouverais ici.

English: These flowers are beautiful, aren't they?
French: Ces fleurs sont belles, n'est-ce pas ?

English: You're just jealous, that's all.
French: Tu es juste jaloux, c'est tout.

English: You're the reason I came.

English: If John phones me, please tell him I'll be back by seven o'clock.
French: Si John téléphone, veuillez lui dire que je serai de retour à six heures.

English: I am from Brazil.
French: Je viens du Brésil.

English: This tie goes well with the suit, I guess.
French: Cette cravate va bien avec le costume, je trouve.

English: These are decisions I want to make alone.
French: Ce sont des décisions que je souhaite prendre seule.

English: Did anyone laugh?

English: She wasn't dancing with him then.
French: Elle ne dansait alors pas avec lui.

English: My uncle lives in Madrid, the capital of Spain.
French: Mon oncle vit à Madrid, la capitale de l'Espagne.

English: Learn these names by heart.
French: Apprends ces noms par cœur.

English: He didn't want to sell the book.
French: Il n'a pas voulu vendre le livre.

English: Here's the answer to your question.

English: Are you here to spy on me?

English: They'll tell you the truth.

English: Wait for us.

English: We want to make a simple change.

English: They haven't slept for forty-eight hours.

English: Tom doesn't want us to leave.

English: Recently, many people are finding it hard to make a decent living.

English: I'll have dinner.

English: I can't stand this hot weather.

English: I'm not too worried about Tom.

English: Are you being paid for doing this?

English: It's very simple.

English: Tom didn't look as happy as Mary.

English: I'm happy to see you in one piece.

English: I've been here almost three years now.

English: Can he speak French?

French: J'étais sur le point de l'appeler, mais je me suis ravisé.

English: He was promoted to colonel two years ago.
French: Il fut élevé au rang de colonel il y a deux ans.

English: The movie Tom was watching wasn't in French.
French: Le film que Tom regardait n'était pas en français.

English: I just don't want your dog in my house.
French: Je ne veux pas de votre chien dans ma maison, un point c'est tout.

English: These mosquitos are eating me alive!

French: Comment consoler une mère qui vient de perdre son seul enfant ?

English: I have a 13-year-old son.

English: I have three pieces of baggage.

English: Do I have to undress?

English: Does she have a big nose?

English: That's all changed now.

English: We can try.

English: The apartment is in flames.

English: What time did you get home?

English: I feel bad that I haven't paid you yet.

English: I'm right, aren't I?

English: What happened was unexpected.

English: I have a serious problem with that.

English: I used to wear glasses.

English: I promise not to sing.

English: There is little water left.

French: Je ne peux pas vous dire combien je suis heureuse que vous soyez venus nous rendre visite.

English: I had a breakdown.

English: It is raining hard.

English: Would you sing for me?

English: That's not how I feel.

English: We must come up with a plan.

English: He glanced at her with no sign of recognition.
French: Il lui jeta un coup d'œil sans montrer de signe de reconnaissance.

English: I'm saving this seat for Tom.
French: Je garde ce siège pour Tom.

English: When did you buy it?

English: I remember seeing you last year.
French: Je me rappelle vous avoir vu l'année passée.

English: Tom understands French better than he speaks it.
French: Tom comprend le français mieux qu'il ne le parle.

English: They kidnapped me.

English: I know what it's like to be alone.

English: You were great today.
French: Tu as été génial aujourd'hui.

English: I don't believe that ghosts exist.
French: Je ne crois pas à l'existence des fantômes.

English: Look what I found under the sofa.
French: Regarde ce que j'ai trouvé sous le canapé.

English: Do you have any more of those?

English: We have witnesses.

English: Tom is an unusual kid.
French: Tom est un enfant inhabituel.

English: The house has been bought.
French: La maison a été achetée.

English: Sit down with me.

English: I need to buy a new notebook.
French: Je dois acheter un nouveau cahier.

English: I need to buy some stamps.
French: Il me faut acheter des timbres.

English: How about sleeping at home?
French: Que dites-vous de dormir à la maison ?

English: Just don't drop it.

English: I'll keep it a secret. Don't worry.
French: Je le garderai secret. Ne vous en faites pas.

English: You need to work together.

English: Cookie is the cutest of all the dogs.
French: Cookie est le plus mignon de tous les chiens.

English: I need to borrow your car.
French: Il me faut emprunter votre voiture.

English: Don't take this personally.
French: Ne le prenez pas personnellement !

English: I'm used to it.
French: J'y suis habitué.

English: We're going for a walk.
French: Nous allons nous promener.

English: What year were you born?
French: En quelle année êtes-vous née ?

English: You're weak.
French: Tu es faible.

English: I like women.
French: J'apprécie les femmes.

English: A fight broke out between two schoolboys.
French: Une bagarre éclata entre deux élèves.

English: I want you to take a look at this.
French: Je veux que vous jetiez un œil à ceci.

English: I had to look after the children.
French: J'ai dû surveiller les enfants.

English: This road will take you down to the edge of Lake Biwa.
French: Cette route vous amène au bord du lac Biwa.

English: Ask Tom to explain it.
French: Demande à Tom de l'expliquer.

English: She's made up her mind and refuses to be talked out of it.
French: Elle a pris sa décision et refuse d'en être dissuadée.

English: Tom wouldn't let me call an ambulance so I drove him to the hospital myself.
French: Tom a refusé que j'appelle une ambulance alors je l'ai amené à l'hôpital par moi-même.

English: How did you know what I was thinking?
French: Comment saviez-vous ce que je pensais ?

English: Where's my ring?

English: When it was time to vote, he abstained.
French: Quand ce fut le moment de voter, il s'abstint.

English: Come and warm yourself by the fire.
French: Venez vous réchauffer au coin du feu.

English: I helped you when you needed help.
French: Je t'ai aidé quand tu avais besoin d'aide.

English: The more time you spend talking about what you do, the less time you have to do it.
French: Plus tu passes de temps à parler de ce que tu fais, moins de temps tu as pour le faire.

English: I hope it wasn't too boring.
French: J'espère que ce n'était pas trop ennuyeux.

English: Her eyes are blue.
French: Ses yeux sont bleus.

English: You shouldn't trust that man.
French: Tu ne devrais pas faire confiance à cet homme.

English: Do you get it?

English: What foreign languages have you studied?
French: Quelles langues étrangères avez-vous étudiées ?

English: We haven't lost much.
French: Nous n'avons pas beaucoup perdu.

English: He is used to speaking in public.
French: Il est habitué à parler en public.

English: I've lived a long life.
French: J'ai vécu une longue vie.

English: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.
French: Lorsque nous travaillions ensemble, il ne cessait de me charrier.

English: No pain, no gain.
French: On n'a rien sans rien.

English: Thanks for the pizza.
French: Merci pour la pizza.

English: Tom told me he was retired.
French: Tom m'a dit qu'il était retraité.

English: I heard that Tom doesn't speak French.
French: J'ai entendu dire que Tom ne parle pas français.

English: Unfortunately, she didn't come.
French: Malheureusement, elle n'est pas venue.

English: Tom hates Halloween.
French: Tom déteste Halloween.

English: You can go to the station by bus.
French: Vous pouvez aller à la gare en bus.

English: When do you plan to start?
French: Quand prévois-tu de commencer ?

English: I wish he had gone on to university.
French: J’aurais aimé qu’il aille à l’université.

English: I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
French: J'ai hâte d'avoir de tes nouvelles.

English: He is doing a super job.
French: Il fait un super boulot.

English: What's your favorite subject?
French: Quel est ta matière préférée ?

English: I've been alone for a long time.
French: Je suis seule depuis longtemps.

English: Has something happened to Tom?
French: Quelque chose est-il arrivé à Tom ?

English: The pain went away because I took the pills.
French: La douleur est partie parce que j'ai pris les cachets.

English: That's no way to speak to your parents.
French: Ce n'est pas une façon de parler à tes parents.

English: I just can't remember.
French: Je ne m'en souviens simplement pas.

English: I don't think we should go outside today.
French: Je ne pense pas qu'on devrait aller dehors aujourd'hui.

English: How many counties are there in Florida?
French: Combien de comtés y a-t-il en Floride ?

English: I can't believe we're doing this.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que nous le fassions.

English: I can't believe he kissed you.
French: Je ne parviens pas à croire qu'il t'ait embrassé.

English: You have to memorize this sentence.
French: Tu dois mémoriser cette phrase.

English: It was because he was sick that he decided to return home.
French: C'est parce qu'il était malade qu'il a décidé de rentrer chez lui.

English: Look at this picture.
French: Regarde ce tableau.

English: You were perfect.
French: Vous avez été parfait.

English: They didn't expect me to refuse.
French: Elles ne s'attendaient pas à ce que je refuse.

English: I eat everything.
French: Je mange tout.

English: She asked him if he knew where I lived.
French: Elle lui a demandé s'il savait où je vivais.

English: Fortunately, they escaped the danger.
French: Par chance, ils ont échappé au danger.

English: I'm happy to be back.
French: Je suis heureux d'être de retour.

English: No one here knows anything.
French: Personne ici ne sait quoi que ce soit.

English: Some kinds of birds can't fly.
French: Certaines espèces d'oiseaux ne peuvent pas voler.

English: Can I have everyone's attention please?

English: I cannot afford a camera above 300 dollars.
French: Je ne peux pas me permettre d'acheter un appareil-photo de plus de 300 dollars.

English: Something unusual happened last night.
French: Quelque chose d'inhabituel s'est passé la nuit dernière.

English: It is fun to play cards.
French: C'est amusant de jouer aux cartes.

English: I didn't speak.
French: Je n'ai pas parlé.

English: How did you get into my house?

English: Who is in the house?

English: The more information you give me, the better the advice I can provide you.
French: Plus vous me donnerez d'informations, meilleurs seront les conseils que je pourrai vous donner.

English: Tom knows it's hopeless.
French: Tom sait que c'est sans espoir.

English: Tom refused to eat.
French: Tom refusa de manger.

English: It's possible that Tom lied to you.
French: Il est possible que Tom vous ait menti.

English: She is always dressed in black.
French: Elle est toujours vêtue de noir.

English: These lemon and almond tarts are scrumptious.
French: Ces tartelettes au citron et amandes sont délicieuses.

English: I will say something about it.

English: I think this is the only way to do it.

English: You can never tell how long these meetings will last.

English: I wasn't asleep.

English: This is an extremely serious matter.
French: C'est une affaire extrêmement grave.

English: Lie still.
French: Restez allongées, immobiles !

English: I just got up.
French: Je viens de me lever.

English: I'm not letting you do this.
French: Je ne vais pas vous laisser faire ça.

English: You're incredibly talented.
French: Tu es incroyablement talentueuse.

English: You'd better go to bed at once.
French: Tu ferais mieux d'aller dormir immédiatement.

English: Tom knows where I am.
French: Tom sait où je suis.

English: I have a passport.
French: J'ai un passeport.

English: Can you save enough money for the down payment?

English: I lost my way in the woods.
French: J'ai perdu mon chemin dans les bois.

English: Keep still.
French: Reste tranquille !

English: Employers sometimes exploit their workers.
French: Les employeurs exploitent parfois leurs travailleurs.

English: One of you is lying.
French: L'un de vous ment.

English: This glass contains water.
French: Ce verre contient de l'eau.

English: I love your son.
French: J'aime ton fils.

English: We've still got a lot of time.
French: Nous avons encore beaucoup de temps.

English: I'd like to do that.
French: J'aimerais faire ça.

English: What's the hurry?

English: I put it here somewhere.
French: Je l'ai mis quelque part ici.

English: Did he go there?
French: Est-il allé là?

English: My cousin is having a baby next month.
French: Mon cousin va avoir un bébé le mois prochain.

English: He introduced the problem of education into the conversation.
French: Il a introduit le problème de l'éducation dans la conversation.

English: I can run the fastest of the three.
French: Je peux courir plus rapidement que les trois autres.

English: I just didn't want you to worry.

English: My heart began to beat fast.

English: I'm sure my parents won't let me go by myself.
French: Je suis certain que mes parents ne me laisseront pas aller seul.

English: She is certainly over forty.

English: I hear it's buried under all that snow.

English: I must find some new friends.

English: I just can't help worrying about you.
French: Je ne peux simplement pas m'empêcher de me faire du souci à ton sujet.

English: What's in the bag?

English: Did you invite him?

English: It is on this point that our opinions differ.
French: C'est sur ce point que nos opinions diffèrent.

English: Why don't we take a taxi?
French: Pourquoi ne prenons-nous pas un taxi ?

English: She doesn't understand you.
French: Elle ne te comprend pas.

English: He took a taxi in order not to miss the train.
French: Il a pris un taxi pour ne pas rater le train.

English: No one is to leave.
French: Personne n'est sur le point de partir.

English: I won't fight with you anymore.

English: How do you plan to get home?

English: The road is in a deplorable state.
French: La route se trouve dans un état déplorable.

English: Tom understood everything.
French: Tom a tout compris.

English: The decision has not yet been made.
French: La décision n'a pas encore été prise.

English: I did that yesterday.
French: Je l'ai fait hier.

English: Tom wasn't at all surprised.
French: Tom n'était pas du tout surpris.

English: Close the door after you.
French: Fermez la porte derrière vous.

English: I don't even know how to dance.
French: Je ne sais même pas danser.

English: The castle might be haunted.
French: Le château pourrait être hanté.

English: They wake up at six every morning.
French: Ils se lèvent à six heures tous les matins.

English: The man who came to visit you didn't say who he was.
French: L'homme qui est venu te voir ne s'est pas présenté.

English: I'm waiting to see if it's true.
French: J'attends de voir si c'est vrai.

English: Tom, what are you doing here?
French: Tom, que fais-tu ici ?

English: We're really angry.
French: Nous sommes vraiment en colère.

English: Tom was unshaven.
French: Tom n'était pas rasé.

English: That comes to the same thing.
French: Ça revient au même.

English: I don't even want to hazard a guess.
French: Je ne veux même pas hasarder une hypothèse.

English: I hope something good happens before the day is over.
French: J'espère que quelque chose de bien va se produire avant que la journée soit finie.

English: He confessed his guilt.
French: Il a confessé sa culpabilité.

English: We're so sorry.
French: Nous sommes tellement désolés.

English: I've done no such thing.
French: Je n'ai rien fait de tel.

English: You've been great.
French: Vous avez été super !

English: A young man waited in line to see him.
French: Un jeune homme attendait son tour pour le voir.

English: I left the money with him.
French: Je lui ai prêté de l'argent.

English: I've been looking for it all morning.
French: Je l'ai cherché toute la matinée.

English: He never wears a tie.
French: Il ne met jamais de cravate.

English: How many eggs are there in the kitchen?
French: Combien y a-t-il d'œufs dans la cuisine ?

English: I'm asking you as a friend.
French: Je te le demande en tant qu'ami.

English: He was impressed.
French: Il a été impressionné.

English: Are you good at tennis?
French: Es-tu bonne au tennis ?

English: A female friend of mine loves to go to gay bars with me.
French: Une amie à moi adore aller dans les bars gays avec moi.

English: This doesn't fit.
French: Ça ne correspond pas.

English: What happened at that intersection?
French: Qu'est-il arrivé à ce croisement ?

English: Yours was better.
French: Le tien était mieux.

English: Why did God create the universe?
French: Pourquoi Dieu a-t-il créé l'univers ?

English: Are you sure this is what you want?
French: Es-tu sûre que c'est ce que tu veux ?

English: Tom is the best French teacher I know.
French: Tom est le meilleur professeur de français que je connais.

English: I feel strongly about this.
French: C'est une question qui me tient très à cœur.

English: The regulation was abolished, but then it was reenacted.
French: La réglementation fut abolie, mais fut ensuite remise en vigueur.

English: Where's my tie?
French: Où est ma cravate ?

English: Let's get the party going.
French: Mettons la fête sur pieds.

English: She left home after three days.
French: Elle est partie de chez elle au bout de trois jours.

English: I know you haven't done it yet.
French: Je sais que tu ne l'as pas encore fait.

English: I have a green shirt.
French: J'ai une chemise verte.

English: I learned to cook from my mother.
French: J'ai appris à cuisiner par ma mère.

English: I'm volunteering.
French: Je me porte volontaire.

English: Thanks for your hard work.
French: Merci d'avoir travaillé si durement.

English: The earth is a lot larger than the moon.
French: La Terre est beaucoup plus grande que la Lune.

English: This is depressing.
French: C'est déprimant.

English: That was a cheap shot.
French: C'était une bassesse.

English: I kept on talking.
French: J'ai continué à parler.

English: Does Tom like to swim?
French: Tom aime-t-il nager ?

English: Sometimes I wonder whether or not I made the right decision.
French: Parfois, je me demande si j'ai pris ou pas la bonne décision.

English: You can see how much difference a few degrees can make.
French: Vous pouvez voir quelle différence quelques degrés font.

English: Now shake hands and make up.
French: Maintenant serrez-vous la main et réconciliez-vous.

English: That would be nice, don't you think?
French: Ce serait bien, vous ne pensez pas ?

English: I should not have done that. It was wrong.
French: Je n'aurais pas dû faire ça. C'était une erreur.

English: Fortunately he didn't die in the accident.
French: Heureusement il n'est pas mort dans l'accident.

English: We've missed the boat.
French: Nous avons loupé le coche.

English: Is the tap water in Australia drinkable?
French: L’eau du robinet est-elle potable, en Australie ?

English: Sister, don't let this patient out of your sight.
French: Ma sœur, ne quittez pas ce patient des yeux.

English: Do you think I did it?
French: Penses-tu que je l'aie fait ?

English: He exchanged his old car for a new one.
French: Il a échangé sa vieille voiture pour une nouvelle.

English: Why don't you run for student council?
French: Pourquoi ne te portes-tu pas candidate au conseil des élèves ?

English: She went with him.
French: Elle est allée avec lui.

English: I think that's enough for now.
French: Je pense que c'est assez pour le moment.

English: I have a flat tire.

English: I'd be happy if that happened again.
French: Je serais heureux que ça se reproduise.

English: There is almost no violence in that city.
French: Il n'y a presque pas de violence dans cette ville.

English: He is nothing more than a dreamer.
French: Il n'est qu'un rêveur.

English: Tom had to sleep in the living room on the couch because Mary's dog didn't let him get in his room.
French: Tom a dû dormir dans le salon sur le canapé, parce que le chien de Maria ne l'a pas laissé entrer dans la chambre.

English: Everybody liked Tom.
French: Tout le monde aimait Tom.

English: I don't know when I can take a break.
French: Je ne sais pas quand je peux prendre une pause.

English: In my city, the temperature is one degree above zero.
French: Dans ma ville, la température est un degré au-dessus de zéro.

English: We've been warned.
French: On nous a prévenus.

English: You see that tall building over there, don't you?
French: Tu vois ce bâtiment là-bas, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I stopped smoking once and for all.
French: J'ai arrêté de fumer une bonne fois pour toutes.

English: You've misunderstood.
French: Tu as compris de travers.

English: Tom slept in this morning.
French: Tom a fait la grasse matinée aujourd'hui.

English: This blouse is cotton.
French: Ce chemisier est en coton.

English: I couldn't have done that if you hadn't been helping me.
French: Je n'aurais pas pu faire cela si tu ne m'avais pas aidée.

English: I love reading books.
French: J'adore lire des livres.

English: Do you eat spaghetti by twirling it around your fork?
French: Manges-tu les spaghettis en les enroulant autour de ta fourchette ?

English: I was a volunteer for two afternoons.
French: J'ai été bénévole pendant deux après-midis.

English: Tom won't mind.
French: Ça ne dérangera pas Tom.

English: I've already explained that.
French: J'ai déjà expliqué ça.

English: In her free time, she likes to be on the Internet.
French: Pendant son temps libre, elle aime être sur Internet.

English: Let's stop this argument.
French: Arrêtons cette controverse.

English: Do you agree with Tom?
French: Es-tu d'accord avec Tom ?

English: I can't wait to eat it.
French: Je suis impatient de le manger.

English: She will become a doctor.
French: Elle deviendra médecin.

English: I'm a tourist.
French: Je suis un touriste.

English: Tom was knocked unconscious.
French: Tom a été assommé.

English: You didn't drink that water, did you?
French: Tu n'as pas bu cette eau, hein ?

English: When I phone them nobody answers.
French: Quand je leur téléphone, personne ne répond.

English: Finally, I found the answer to your question.
French: Finalement, j'ai trouvé la réponse à la question.

English: He plays golf every Sunday.
French: Il joue au golf tous les dimanches.

English: It was very cool.
French: C'était très sympa.

English: I prefer tea to coffee.
French: Je préfère le thé au café.

English: The rainy season begins towards the end of June.
French: La saison des pluies commence vers la fin du mois de juin.

English: I can't do anything.
French: Je ne peux rien faire.

English: Is this a challenge?
French: S'agit-il d'un défi ?

English: I do not think that she is at home.
French: Je ne pense pas qu'elle se trouve chez elle.

English: Maybe it's not a good idea.
French: Peut-être que ce n'est pas une bonne idée.

English: It is an endangered species.
French: C'est une espèce en voie de disparition.

English: Do you want to sleep on the couch?
French: Voulez-vous dormir sur le canapé?

English: They're out of their minds.

English: The house is on fire!

English: He is looking at what used to be my father's desk.
French: Il regarde ce qui fut le bureau de mon père.

English: It looks like you've regained your confidence.
French: Il semble que vous ayez retrouvé votre assurance.

English: I'd like to thank you for coming today.
French: J'aimerais te remercier d'être venu aujourd'hui.

English: It made me laugh.

English: I thought you had somewhere else to be.
French: Je pensais que vous aviez un autre endroit où aller.

English: That was a big mistake, wasn't it?
French: Ce fut une grave erreur, n'est-ce pas ?

English: He is rarely, if ever, late for appointments.
French: Il est rarement, voire jamais, en retard aux rendez-vous.

English: Do you know what I mean?

English: He will have to undergo an operation next week.
French: Il devra subir une opération la semaine prochaine.

English: Ask me again in October.

English: He is a pretty great guy.

English: No one ate any of the cookies that I made.
French: Personne n'a mangé le moindre des biscuits que j'ai faits.

English: Space travel is dangerous.
French: Les voyages spatiaux sont dangereux.

English: They came last week.
French: Elles sont venues la semaine passée.

English: I don't regret what happened last night.
French: Je ne regrette pas ce qui s'est produit la nuit passée.

English: Tom will be waiting for me.
French: Tom sera en train de m'attendre.

English: Do you have difficulty losing weight?
French: Avez-vous du mal à perdre du poids ?

English: You have more energy than I do.
French: Vous avez davantage d'énergie que moi.

English: In a sense, you are right.
French: En un certain sens, vous avez raison.

English: Tom went on a business trip last week.
French: Tom est allé en voyage d'affaires la semaine dernière.

English: Her dress was torn.
French: Ses vêtements étaient déchirés.

English: How did you get so good at French?
French: Comment êtes-vous devenu si bon en français ?

English: Tom said Mary was coming over for dinner.
French: Tom a dit que Marie venait pour le dîner.

English: I'm training for the triathlon.
French: Je m'entraîne pour le triathlon.

English: It's not personal.
French: Ce n'est pas personnel.

English: How can you be so sure?

English: I don't want to take care of a dog.
French: Je ne veux pas prendre soin d'un chien.

English: I told Tom we were friends.
French: J'ai dit à Tom que nous étions amis.

English: You all right?

English: Would you be willing to show me how to do that?
French: Serais-tu disposée à me montrer comment le faire ?

English: They'll be rooting for you.
French: Ils te soutiendront.

English: She surprised him when she arrived early.
French: Elle le surprit lorsqu'elle arriva tôt.

English: Her home is in the suburbs.
French: Sa maison est en banlieue.

English: Are you out of your minds?
French: Avez-vous perdu l'esprit ?

English: You had better not use those four-letter words.
French: Tu ferais mieux de ne pas utiliser ces mots de quatre lettres.

English: No one followed me.

English: You'd better do as the doctor advised you.
French: Tu ferais mieux de faire comme le médecin t'a conseillé.

English: Why don't you mind your own business?

English: I just want to tell Tom before somebody else does.
French: Je veux simplement parler à Tom avant que quelqu'un d'autre le fasse.

English: Tom was afraid that they'd lock him up and throw away the key.
French: Tom avait peur qu'ils l'enferment et jettent la clé.

English: The rent is cheap.
French: Le loyer n'est pas cher.

English: They'll know what to do.
French: Ils sauront quoi faire.

English: My father is too busy to take a walk.
French: Mon père est trop occupé pour aller se balader.

English: That was great.
French: C'tait super.

English: Tom wiped his face with a towel.
French: Tom essuya son visage avec une serviette.

English: This is a doghouse that I made myself.
French: C'est une niche que j'ai confectionnée moi-même.

English: You didn't prepare me for this.
French: Tu ne m'as pas préparé à ça.

English: She pushed him out the window.
French: Elle l'a poussé par la fenêtre.

English: I found the money.
French: J’ai trouvé l’argent.

English: Come back this afternoon.
French: Revenez cet après-midi.

English: This is new.
French: C'est neuf.

English: You're hiding something. "No, I'm not."
French: « Tu me caches quelque chose. » « Non, pas du tout. »

English: If only I'd done my homework!
French: Si seulement j'avais fait mes devoirs !

English: I know he's the one who did it.
French: Je sais que c'est lui qui l'a fait.

English: I still think Tom is hiding something.
French: Je pense toujours que Tom cache quelque chose.

English: You disobeyed a direct order and must pay the consequences.
French: Tu as désobéi à un ordre direct et tu dois en payer les conséquences.

English: I need help from someone.
French: J'ai besoin de l'aide de quelqu'un.

English: Have you done this before?
French: Avez-vous fait cela auparavant ?

English: Sorry about the mess.
French: Désolé pour la pagaille !

English: Tom is the person I saw yesterday.
French: Tom est la personne que j'ai vue hier.

English: A blast of cold air swept through the house.
French: Une rafale de vent froid déferla sur la maison.

English: I go where I'm told to go.
French: Je vais là où on me dit de me rendre.

English: They won't get past me.
French: Ils ne me dépasseront pas.

English: That's my own personal opinion.
French: C'est mon opinion personnelle.

English: My mother was usually very busy.
French: Ma mère était d'ordinaire très occupée.

English: I've changed my daily routine.
French: J'ai changé ma routine quotidienne.

English: She is used to sitting.
French: Elle est habituée à se tenir assise.

English: I sold it for ten dollars.
French: Je l'ai vendue pour dix dollars.

English: Coffee, please, with cream and sugar.
French: Un café avec du sucre et de la crème s'il vous plait.

English: It's bad luck to say that.
French: Ça porte malheur de dire ça.

English: That's a fake.
French: C'est un faux.

English: Do it the way he tells you to.
French: Faites-le de la manière qu'il vous indique.

English: Which bed do you want to use?
French: Quel lit veux-tu utiliser ?

English: What language do you speak?
French: Quelle langue parles-tu ?

English: Is that a trick question?
French: Est-ce une question piège ?

English: I think we did OK.
French: Je pense que nous nous en sommes bien sortis.

English: I went outside early in the morning.
French: Je suis sorti tôt le matin.

English: Tom took his clothes off and put them into the washing machine.
French: Tom retira ses vêtements et les mit dans la machine à laver.

English: I need some time to think.
French: Il me faut un peu de temps pour réfléchir.

English: Do you need a lift?
French: Vous avez besoin d'un chauffeur ?

English: I was told to be quiet.
French: On m'a dit de rester silencieux.

English: Why are you waiting?
French: Pourquoi êtes-vous en train d'attendre ?

English: The letters were delivered.
French: Les lettres furent acheminées.

English: Please give me a piece of bread.
French: Donnez-moi un morceau de pain, s'il vous plait.

English: I want it.
French: Je le veux.

English: You weren't there, were you?
French: Vous n'étiez pas là, si ?

English: You're very brave.
French: Vous êtes fort braves.

English: I didn't mean to disturb you.
French: Je n'avais pas l'intention de te déranger.

English: I had to beg my friends to come to my party.
French: J'ai dû supplier mes amis de venir à ma fête.

English: Were you born here?
French: Êtes-vous né ici ?

English: What's your favorite way to travel?
French: Quelle est votre façon de voyager préférée ?

English: The audience clapped loudly after his speech.
French: L'assistance applaudit bruyamment après son discours.

English: I do not understand her.
French: Je ne la comprends pas.

English: Wires transmit electricity.
French: Les câbles transmettent l'électricité.

English: I don't even know what to do.
French: Je ne sais même pas quoi faire.

English: The dolphin and trainer communicated much better than we expected.
French: Le dauphin et le dresseur communiquaient beaucoup mieux que nous ne nous y attendions.

English: Have you gone mad?
French: Es-tu devenue folle ?

English: You are free to do as you please with your money.
French: Vous êtes libre de faire ce que bon vous semble avec votre argent.

English: Did Tom break your heart?
French: Tom t'a-t-il brisé le cœur ?

English: My sister is bugging me.
French: Ma sœur me casse les pieds.

English: Where did you go?
French: Où êtes-vous allées ?

English: That might help.
French: Ça pourrait aider.

English: All the girls wanted to dance with Tom.
French: Toutes les filles voulaient danser avec Tom.

English: That's the last thing I remember.
French: C'est la dernière chose dont je me souviens.

English: He still has much to learn.
French: Il a encore beaucoup à apprendre.

English: I would like to tell you something.
French: J'aimerais vous dire quelque chose.

English: I keep a diary.
French: Je tiens un journal.

English: Neither of them looks busy.
French: Aucun d'entre eux n'a l'air occupé.

English: Can I take a message?
French: Puis-je prendre un message ?

English: You should refrain from smoking.
French: Tu devrais t'abstenir de fumer.

English: Mom, can Tom stay for dinner?
French: Maman, est-ce que Tom peut rester dîner?

English: I'm unconvinced.
French: Je ne suis pas convaincu.

English: Copper conducts electricity well.
French: Le cuivre conduit bien l'électricité.

English: I have no idea what you're talking about.
French: Je n'ai aucune idée de quoi tu parles.

English: I try to please everyone.
French: J'essaie de faire plaisir à tout le monde.

English: You should not go alone.
French: Tu ne devrais pas y aller seul.

English: I have to think of the future.
French: Je dois penser au futur.

English: I asked Tom if he would go, too.
French: J'ai demandé à Tom s'il voulait aussi venir.

English: I want you to have my land after I die.
French: Je veux qu'une fois que je serai mort, tu disposes de ma terre.

English: Where are all the others?
French: Où sont tous les autres ?

English: You could have drowned.
French: Vous auriez pu vous noyer !

English: Aren't you hungry?
French: Tu n'as pas faim ?

English: My father might be at home now.
French: Il se peut que mon père se trouve chez lui, à l'heure actuelle.

English: I wish you would take me to a restaurant for a change.
French: J'aimerais que tu m'emmènes au restaurant pour changer.

English: Tom doesn't still do that.

English: I doubt that's what really happened.
French: Je doute que ce soit là ce qui a effectivement eu lieu.

English: I had an amazing experience.

English: They smell bad.

English: I want to show you something very special.

English: Mary looks like her mother, but she has a different personality.
French: Marie ressemble à sa mère mais elle a une personnalité différente.

French: Ce maillot de bain va vraiment bien sur toi.

English: I think you might have a drinking problem.

English: Do you have someplace to stay?

English: Don't you ever clean your room?

English: Whatever happens, I want you to know that I love you.
French: Quoi qu'il arrive, je veux que tu saches que je vous aime.

English: I can't make it to your party next weekend.
French: Je ne peux pas venir à votre fête le week-end prochain.

English: You must be cautious.

English: If I were in her place, I wouldn't give up yet.

English: What's going to happen?

English: You're scared of being hurt, aren't you?

English: Where's the kitchen?

English: She is in her hotel now.

English: I liked them before they were popular.

English: It was kind of you to help me.

English: Is anyone else going?

English: Stand up.

English: I want to give you some money to help you through these hard times.

English: We know all about that.

English: Never choose a vocation just because your friends are in it, nor refuse another just because your worst enemy is in it.
French: Ne choisissez jamais une vocation juste parce que vos amis s'y trouvent, pas plus que n'en refusez une autre juste parce que s'y trouve votre pire ennemi.

English: I apologize for not writing to you before.

English: I know that it is highly unlikely that we'll see any whales today.
French: Je sais qu'il est hautement improbable que nous voyions la moindre baleine aujourd'hui.

English: It is ten minutes before eleven.

English: Please insert a coin.

English: She likes jazz, and so do I.

English: I need a haircut.

English: Smoking is prohibited in all public buildings.

English: There were enough.

English: I hear someone singing.

English: It's a no-brainer.

English: Give me the car key, please.
French: Donnez-moi la clé de la voiture, s'il vous plaît.

English: An accident just happened.

English: I would like a large slice of cake and a cup of coffee.
French: J'aimerais bien un gros morceau de gâteau et une tasse de café.

English: He isn't at home.

English: Tom is a skilled player.

English: What in the world got into you?

English: He is riding a bicycle.

English: With the approach of Christmas, business improved somewhat.
French: À l'approche de Noël, le commerce a quelque peu repris.

English: What is our plan?

English: Why doesn't anybody help you?

English: I can't decide if I'm happy or sad.

English: Tell them we need an ambulance.

English: I've figured it out.

English: Quit behaving like a kid.

English: I don't get out much.

English: Let's go to a concert together.

English: Tom and Mary looked at each other, and then suddenly they started kissing.
French: Tom et Mary se regardèrent l'un l'autre puis se mirent soudainement à s'embrasser.

English: I'm always learning something new.
French: J'apprends toujours quelque chose de nouveau.

English: There were some unexpected questions.
French: Il y a eu quelques questions inattendues.

English: Tom said he hoped he'd be able to help us.

English: I don't know what you do.

English: I'd like to go back to the office.

English: Why do you want to be a doctor?

English: His clothes are worn out.

English: You're in a restricted area.

English: He has been secretly in love with her.

English: Tom certainly gets a nice sound out of that old bassoon.

English: I wanted to make new friends.

English: We have to be careful.

English: Kunihiko hit the target with his first shot.

English: I ran as fast as I could, but I missed the train.

English: There is strength in numbers.

English: Would you like to play tennis every Sunday?

English: I've run out of money.

English: I can't go back to prison.

English: Do as you please.

English: He is the only one of my friends that is talented.

English: He admitted his mistakes.

English: After I graduated from college, I moved back home and lived with my parents for three years.
French: Après avoir été diplômé de l'école, j'ai de nouveau emménagé chez moi et vécu avec mes parents pendant trois ans.

English: Have a look.

English: I thought you'd be happy.

English: I look forward to seeing you again very soon.

English: What's going on tonight?

English: It's serious.

English: No one uses that word anymore.

English: We have no way to verify this.

English: Why are you so hard-headed?

English: They cheat.

English: Tom told me not to say anything to you.

English: I like to be surprised.

English: I'll pay you.

English: I'm a house painter.

English: I should go home before my parents start to worry.

English: I'm sorry. I'm a stranger around here.
French: Je suis désolé. Je ne suis pas d'ici.

English: Would you mind if I borrowed this?

English: Tom wears thick glasses.

English: Everybody at school hates me.

English: Don't you think that's strange?

English: When did you buy it?

English: I'll examine it for myself.

English: He is saving money for a trip abroad.

English: If you want to dance, then dance.

English: Who gave the command?

English: He wondered why she did that.

English: She is fit for the job.

English: Your memory is good.

English: I was jealous of you.

English: I like listening to good music.

English: What an inspiring speaker!

English: She's starting to annoy me.

English: Tom is waiting for you in his office.

English: The speed of the spread of AIDS is horrifyingly fast.
French: La vitesse de propagation du SIDA est horriblement rapide.

English: Can we recycle this?

English: I learned that from you.

English: I like movies.

English: I think I have a gum infection.

English: Would you like that?

English: I knew you wouldn't listen to me.

English: I'm sure it won't be easy to do that.

English: It smells like bleach.

English: I'll come tomorrow morning.

English: Dozens of letters are awaiting you.
French: Des douzaines de lettres vous attendent.

English: He was very hurt by her cruel words.
French: Il a été vraiment blessé par ses mots cruels.

English: I don't have my purse.

English: I would like some envelopes.

English: They look confused.

English: I enjoy eating with you.
French: J'ai plaisir à manger avec toi.

English: How can you be so callous?

English: Tom rejected the offer.

English: Where exactly did you go?

English: She put on socks.

English: During the war, factories ran around the clock.
French: Pendant la guerre, les usines tournaient vingt-quatre heures sur vingt-quatre.

English: There's no way I'm taking the rap for his mistakes.
French: Il n'est pas question que je me fasse enguirlander à cause de ses erreurs.

English: We can't let this continue.
French: Nous ne pouvons laisser cela perdurer.

English: I think Tom would tell the truth.
French: Je pense que Tom dirait la vérité.

English: What do you say we go there?

English: That is the worst thing you can do!

English: Tom folded his shirts.

English: Let's go downtown.

English: Tom backed up his data.

English: Tom said he enjoyed the show.
French: Tom a dit qu'il a aimé le spectacle.

English: I'll be free this evening.
French: Je serai libre ce soir.

English: We don't do this as often as we used to.

English: I just wish it were easier to do.
French: J'aimerais seulement que ce soit plus facile à faire.

English: Don't you think it's cold?

English: Think about it tonight.
French: Penses-y ce soir.

English: Tom couldn't eat solid food for a week.
French: Tom n'a pas pu manger des aliments solides durant une semaine.

English: That person is like me.
French: Cette personne est comme moi.

English: I thought that was impossible.
French: Je pensais que c'était impossible.

English: Tom told me he didn't get enough sleep.
French: Tom m'a dit qu'il n'avait pas assez dormi.

English: Her father has a general store.
French: Son père gère une épicerie-droguerie.

English: Aren't you a psychologist?

English: He had his license taken away because of reckless driving.
French: Il a eu son permis retiré à cause d'une conduite imprudente.

English: Her belief in God is very firm.
French: C'est une fervente croyante.

English: I'd like to stay for three nights.
French: Je désirerais rester trois nuits.

English: He buttoned up his coat before walking out the door.
French: Il boutonna son manteau avant de sortir par la porte.

English: We're all prisoners.
French: Nous sommes toutes prisonnières.

English: Tom was stripped to the waist.
French: Tom était torse nu.

English: She was in time for the bus.
French: Elle est arrivée à temps pour son bus.

English: Turn right at the next intersection.
French: Tourne à droite à la prochaine intersection.

English: What do you see in him?
French: Que lui trouves-tu ?

English: She is her old self again.
French: Elle est de nouveau elle-même.

English: The house has burnt down.
French: La maison est carbonisée.

English: I think it's time for me to split.
French: Je pense qu'il est temps pour moi de rompre.

English: I think we'll be safe here.
French: Je pense que nous serons ici en sécurité.

English: The crew is tense.
French: L'équipage est tendu.

English: Tom must've been imagining things.
French: Tom doit avoir imaginé des choses.

English: It takes two hours to go to school by bus and train.
French: Cela prend deux heures pour aller à l'école en bus et en train.

English: Some were farmers, some were hunters.
French: Certains étaient des fermiers, certains des chasseurs.

English: You are not a child any more.
French: Tu n'es plus une enfant.

English: I don't know what's happened.
French: J'ignore ce qui s'est passé.

English: I want to ask you some questions.
French: Je veux vous poser des questions.

English: I'd like to see you in my office.
French: J'aimerais te voir dans mon bureau.

English: We shouldn't have bought this car.
French: Nous n'aurions pas dû acheter cette voiture.

English: You must bear in mind what I've just said to you.
French: Tu dois garder à l'esprit ce que je viens de te dire.

English: I knew you'd have a good time.
French: Je savais que vous passeriez un bon moment.

English: I couldn't stand looking at it.
French: Je ne pouvais pas supporter de le regarder.

English: Everybody looked nervous.
French: Tout le monde avait l'air nerveux.

English: He's definitely not coming.
French: Il ne viendra décidément pas.

English: Am I being unreasonable?

English: It is good for your health to take a walk every morning.
French: C'est bon pour votre santé de faire une balade à pied tous les matins.

English: We're not open on Thanksgiving.
French: Nous ne sommes pas ouvert pour Thanksgiving.

English: He fell in love with her.
French: Il est tombé amoureux d'elle.

English: Anything you say may be used against you.
French: Tout ce que vous dites peut être retenu contre vous.

English: Tom unfastened his seatbelt and got out of the car.
French: Tom a enlevé sa ceinture de sécurité et est sorti de la voiture.

English: Do you like fish?
French: Aimes-tu le poisson ?

English: I'm a vegetarian.
French: Je suis végétarienne.

English: We'll never know.
French: Nous ne le saurons jamais.

English: Tom is very worried about what might happen.
French: Tom est très inquiet de ce qui pourrait se passer.

English: What's that picture inside your locker?
French: Quelle est cette photo à l'intérieur de ton casier ?

English: How much is the tour per person?
French: Combien coûte l'excursion par personne ?

English: I dislike living in such a noisy place.
French: Je n'aime pas vivre dans un endroit si bruyant.

English: May I go home?
French: Puis-je aller à la maison ?

French: Je suis né à Kyoto.

English: This instant soup comes in individual packets.
French: Cette soupe instantanée est en portions individuelles.

English: He's rich and powerful.
French: Il est riche et puissant.

English: The reason is simple.
French: La raison en est très simple.

English: Why are you in such a bad mood?
French: Pourquoi es-tu de si mauvaise humeur ?

English: She wrote to me to come at once.
French: Elle m'écrivit de venir sur-le-champ.

English: Who taught you to write?

English: I don't believe in magic.
French: Je ne crois pas à la magie.

English: I'm not your son.
French: Je ne suis pas ton fils.

English: Where can I find a hospital?
French: Où puis-je trouver un hôpital?

English: Don't tell my girlfriend.

English: Do you understand what I am saying to you?
French: Comprends-tu ce que je te dis ?

English: We sat on the stairs.
French: Nous nous sommes assis sur les escaliers.

English: I'll be waiting for you at the usual place.
French: Je t'attendrai au même endroit que d'habitude.

English: I forgot something important.
French: J'ai oublié quelque chose d'important.

English: You must have made a mistake.

English: I returned Tom's book to him.
French: J'ai rendu son livre à Tom.

English: My boss assigned the hard job to me.
French: Mon patron m'a assigné le travail difficile.

English: We all cried.
French: Nous avons tous pleuré.

English: There was no question about that.
French: Il n'en était pas question.

English: I banged my leg on the coffee table.
French: Je me suis cogné ma jambe sur la table basse.

English: I thought you'd be older.

English: The time will come when your dream will come true.
French: Le moment viendra où ton rêve s'incarnera.

English: The two had been enemies for a long time.
French: Ces deux-là avaient été ennemis depuis longtemps.

English: It was that dog that bit my hand.
French: C'est ce chien là-bas qui m'a mordu la main.

English: You're doing the right thing.
French: Vous faites la bonne chose.

English: Does this look good on me?

English: I deliberately did that.

French: C'est une sacrée histoire.

English: You make it look easy.
French: Vous faites en sorte que ça ait l'air facile.

English: Nothing has been decided.

English: Tell me the reason you were absent from school yesterday.

English: A common way to finance a budget deficit is to issue bonds.
French: Une manière répandue de financer un déficit est de proposer des obligations.

French: Il ne verrouilla pas la porte.

English: This is almost too easy.

English: What did you expect?

English: Don't you ever come back.

English: We could continue.

English: I told you I'm the best.
