English: I want new business cards.
French: Je veux de nouvelles cartes de visite.

English: Do you know how many people in the world starve to death every year?
French: Sais-tu combien de gens dans le monde meurent de faim tous les ans ?

English: All the flowers in the garden withered.
French: Toutes les fleurs du jardin se sont défraîchies.

English: Please tell me the reason why she got angry.
French: S'il te plait, dis-moi pourquoi elle s'est mise en colère.

English: It won't take that long.
French: Ça ne va pas durer aussi longtemps.

English: I had never seen that kind of fish until then.
French: Je n'avais jamais vu ce genre de poisson jusqu'à maintenant.

English: There's no mistaking about that.
French: Il n'y a pas de doute à ce sujet.

English: You're too clever for your own good.
French: Vous êtes trop intelligent pour votre sécurité.

English: There's no right answer.
French: Il n'y a pas de réponse correcte.

English: I would never have guessed that.
French: Je ne l'aurais jamais deviné.

English: What Tom told you was a lie.
French: Ce que vous a dit Tom était un mensonge.

English: Do you want this shirt?

English: Men should work.
French: Les hommes devraient travailler.

English: I didn't know Tom liked me.
French: Je ne savais pas que Tom m'appréciait.

English: She knows my wife.
French: Elle connaît ma femme.

English: Tom helped Mary, didn't he?
French: Tom a aidé Mary, non ?

English: I just got a job.
French: Je viens d'obtenir un boulot.

English: It pays in the long run to buy goods of high quality.
French: Cela paie sur le long terme d'acheter des biens de grande qualité.

English: She asked if she could use the phone, so I let her.
French: Elle a demandé si elle pouvait utiliser le téléphone, alors je l'ai laissé faire.

English: I'm studying English.
French: J'étudie l'anglais.

English: I didn't understand much of what they were talking about.
French: Je n'ai pas compris grand-chose à ce qu'elles étaient en train de discuter.

English: You're either with me or you're against me.

English: She almost never does what she says she's going to do.
French: Elle ne fait pratiquement jamais ce qu'elle dit qu'elle va faire.

English: Tom knows he's partly to blame.
French: Tom sait qu'il est en partie responsable.

English: Tom didn't want to come here, but he came anyway.
French: Tom ne voulait pas venir ici mais il est tout de même venu.

English: Do you think I can pull this off?

English: He was out of breath.

English: Were you able to get the dishwasher to work?
French: As-tu réussi à faire fonctionner le lave-vaisselle ?

English: This is something I must face alone.
French: C'est quelque chose auquel je dois faire face seule.

English: Hackers are adept at getting around computer security measures.
French: Les pirates sont experts dans l'art de contourner les mesures de sécurité informatiques.

English: I don't remember you at all.
French: Je ne me souviens pas du tout de vous.

English: He is complaining about something or other all the time.
French: Il se plaint tout le temps d'une chose ou l'autre.

English: It's time to go to bed.
French: C'est l'heure de se coucher.

English: Search every room.
French: Fouillez chaque chambre.

English: Don't go over the speed limit.
French: Ne dépassez pas la limite de vitesse.

English: He squeezed the toothpaste out of a tube.
French: Il pressa la pâte dentifrice hors du tube.

English: My parents are very old fashioned.
French: Mes parents sont très vieux-jeu.

English: I want you back.
French: Je veux que vous soyez revenu.

French: Mesdames et Messieurs, par ici s'il vous plaît.

English: Doing that will only make things worse.
French: Faire cela ne fera qu'empirer les choses.

English: You need a key to open the box.
French: Il vous faut une clé pour ouvrir le coffre.

English: I wish I could play the guitar as well as you do.
French: J'aimerais pouvoir jouer de la guitare aussi bien que vous.

English: One minute has sixty seconds.
French: Une minute comporte soixante secondes.

English: I have to think about what needs to be done.
French: Je dois réfléchir sur ce qu'il faut faire.

English: I've been up most of the night.
French: J'étais debout presque toute la nuit.

English: When was the potato introduced in Japan?
French: Quand la pomme de terre fut-elle introduite au Japon ?

French: J'apprécierais beaucoup recevoir un exemplaire du livre.

English: What time will you get to the station?
French: À quelle heure atteindrez vous la gare ?

French: Je pense que nous devrions y aller toutes ensemble.

French: Je vous ai posé cette question auparavant.

English: You gotta get more organized.
French: Il faut que tu sois plus organisé.

English: I wonder if there'll be more snow this year than last year.
French: Je me demande s'il y aura davantage de neige cette année que l'année dernière.

English: I don't regret what happened last night.
French: Je ne regrette pas ce qui est arrivé la nuit passée.

English: I'm already done.

English: I suppose you think I'm rich.
French: Je suppose que tu penses que je suis riche.

English: Why do you always want to do things the hard way?

English: Please let me pick up your sister at the station.
French: Veuillez me laisser aller prendre votre sœur à la gare.

English: They were all smiling.

English: I should get some rest.
French: Je devrais prendre du repos.

English: Do you want to hear my theory?
French: Voulez-vous entendre ma théorie ?

English: What scared you?

English: I had a nice chat with her.
French: J'ai eu une discussion sympa avec elle.

English: What's the problem anyway?
French: Quel est le problème, de toutes les manières ?

English: I went to Vienna for the first time last year.
French: Je suis allé pour la première fois à Vienne l'année dernière.

English: Japanese women marry at 26 on average. It is no mystery that the birthrate is declining.
French: Les femmes japonaises se marient en moyenne à 26 ans. Le déclin du taux de natalité n'est pas mystérieux.

English: What did you expect to happen?
French: Qu'espérais-tu qu'il advienne ?

English: I want for you and me to be happy.
French: Je veux que toi et moi soyons heureux.

English: Don't make fun of me.
French: Ne vous moquez pas de moi !

English: Can you juggle?

English: He promised me that he would come at four.
French: Il m'a promis qu'il viendrait à quatre heures.

English: Your cough worries me.
French: Ta toux m'inquiète.

English: I heard someone whistle.
French: J'ai entendu quelqu'un siffler.

English: Tom lives in Australia.
French: Tom habite en Australie.

English: Mary is Tom's wife.
French: Marie est la femme de Tom.

English: There is no film in this camera.
French: Il n'y a pas de film dans cette caméra.

English: You don't seem to love me anymore.
French: Vous semblez ne plus m'aimer.

English: Do you mind if I take a day off?

English: I have a prior engagement.
French: J'ai une obligation antérieure.

English: I have a glass eye.
French: J'ai un œil de verre.

English: I'll try to do my best.
French: J'essaierai de faire de mon mieux.

English: How come you're not dead?
French: Comment se fait-il que vous ne soyez pas mort ?

English: I still think we should've invited Tom to go with us.
French: Je pense toujours que nous aurions dû inviter Tom à venir avec nous.

English: His children have grown up.
French: Ses enfants ont grandi.

English: The police arrested the man who had murdered the girl.
French: La police a arrêté l'homme qui avait tué l'enfant.

English: There is no choice.
French: Il n'y a pas le choix.

English: I can't talk about it.
French: Je ne peux pas en parler.

English: Just think what it could do for you.
French: Pense juste à ce que ça pourrait t'apporter !

English: She watched him draw a picture.
French: Elle le regarda tracer un dessin.

English: I stopped at the supermarket on my way home.
French: Je m'arrêtai au supermarché sur le chemin de la maison.

English: They sat under a tree.
French: Ils s'assirent sous un arbre.

English: I want a pen pal.

English: How is this possible?
French: Comment cela est-il possible ?

English: Tom folded his sheets.
French: Tom a plié ses draps.

English: I thought I'd never see you again.

English: We'll see what Tom has to say about that.
French: Nous verrons ce que Tom a à dire à ce sujet.

English: We're almost out of sugar.
French: Nous sommes presque à court de sucre.

English: It's as good as finished.

English: I know how this looks to you.

English: Close the door, please.
French: Ferme la porte, je te prie !

English: Large catches of squid are a sign of a coming earthquake.
French: Des prises importantes de calamars sont un signe avant-coureur de séisme.

English: He twisted my arm.
French: Il m'a tordu le bras.

English: I think you owe me some money.
French: Je pense que tu me dois de l'argent.

English: I see they've put you to work.
French: Je vois qu'ils vous ont mise au travail.

English: That's all I had to say.
French: C'est tout ce que j'avais à dire.

English: Around half of the audience were female.
French: Environ la moitié du public était des femmes.

English: I outrank you.
French: Je passe avant toi.

English: My sister is crazy about tennis.
French: Ma sœur est fan de tennis.

English: I'm afraid she may have the mumps.
French: J'ai peur qu'elle ait les oreillons.

English: What do you want to eat for lunch?
French: Que veux-tu manger pour le déjeuner?

English: I took what she said literally.
French: J'ai interprété ses propos littéralement.

English: You still haven't told me who he is.
French: Vous ne m'avez pas encore dit qui il est.

English: I did it once.

English: I want a volunteer to help me.
French: Je veux un volontaire pour m'aider.

English: A loophole in the law allowed him to escape prosecution.
French: Un trou dans la législation lui a permis d'échapper à des poursuites.

English: I'll be back in an hour.
French: Je reviens dans une heure.

English: I had to do my duty.

English: Are you listening to me at all?

English: I've been following you.

English: I immediately knew what it was.

English: The tines of the fork are bent.
French: Les dents de la fourchette ont été tordues.

English: You're very intelligent.
French: Tu es très intelligent.

English: There isn't any hope.
French: Il n'y a aucun espoir.

English: There's no way to predict what you will dream tonight.
French: Il n'y a aucun moyen de prévoir ce que tu rêveras cette nuit.

English: Tom, can you hear me?

English: At last, he solved the problem.
French: Il a enfin résolu le problème.

English: Your name is still on the list.
French: Votre nom est encore sur la liste.

English: Tom tasted the wine.
French: Tom goûta le vin.

English: This is the office in which he works.
French: C'est le bureau dans lequel il travaille.

English: I spend a few hours a day maintaining my website.
French: Je passe quelques heures par jour à entretenir mon site web.

English: What're you all dressed up for?
French: En quel honneur vous êtes-vous mises sur votre trente-et-un ?

English: The park was almost empty.
French: Le parc était presque vide.

English: Why would he lie?
French: Pourquoi mentirait-il ?

English: I love you from the bottom of my heart.
French: Je t'aime du fond de mon cœur.

English: Do you still want to be an officer?

English: Who will come with me?

English: They never did what they said they would do.
French: Elles n'ont jamais fait ce qu'elles avaient dit qu'elles feraient.

English: I didn't mean to offend you.
French: Je n'avais pas l'intention de vous offenser.

English: Butter is made from milk.
French: Le beurre est fait à partir de lait.

English: You're so romantic.
French: Tu es si romantique.

English: You still haven't told me why you quit your job.
French: Tu ne m'as toujours pas dit pourquoi tu as démissionné de ce poste.

English: Who are these presents for?

English: We can't go back there.

English: There isn't any milk in the glass.

English: I don't own a television.

English: I'm not busy anymore.

English: You'd better check that.

English: We don't need to attend that meeting.
French: Nous n'avons pas besoin de participer à cette réunion.

English: Who is going to speak tonight?

English: She married a hotshot lawyer from New York.
French: Elle a épousé un avocat new-yorkais de haut vol.

English: I still don't feel safe.
French: Je ne me sens toujours pas en sécurité.

English: Are you free for dinner tonight?
French: Es-tu libre pour dîner, ce soir ?

English: He did it again.
French: Il l'a fait de nouveau.

English: In the end, he did not come.
French: Finalement il n'est pas venu.

English: She picked up the phone.
French: Elle a décroché le téléphone.

English: Adopting a low calorie diet will increase your lifespan.
French: Adopter un régime alimentaire basses-calories augmentera votre durée de vie.

English: Our platoon was ambushed.
French: Notre peloton a été pris en embuscade.

English: Put it down.

English: Would you like to learn to speak English like a native speaker in two weeks?
French: Aimeriez-vous apprendre l'anglais comme langue maternelle en deux semaines ?

English: I knew we'd win.
French: Je savais que nous l'emporterions.

English: It could have been me.
French: Ça aurait pu être moi.

English: Tell us what happened last night.
French: Dites-nous ce qui s'est passé la nuit dernière.

English: Tom wants to open his own restaurant.
French: Tom veut ouvrir son propre restaurant.

English: This house has triple–pane windows.
French: Cette maison est pourvue de fenêtres à triple vitrage.

English: I will be back soon.
French: Je reviens vite.

English: Tom remained unmarried all his life.
French: Tom est resté célibataire toute sa vie.

English: He never loses hope.
French: Il ne perd jamais espoir.

English: These are completely different opinions.
French: Ce sont des opinions tout à fait opposées.

English: Don't be upset.

English: I don't really want you mad at me.

English: Any teacher that can be replaced by a machine should be.
French: Tout professeur qui peut être remplacé par une machine devrait l'être.

French: Je ne sais pas quand c'est arrivé, mais c'est arrivé.

English: I'm very tired.

English: They couldn't help us.

English: You should talk to a specialist.
French: Vous devriez parler à un spécialiste.

English: It's been almost ten years, but you're as beautiful as ever.
French: Cela fait presque déjà dix ans, mais tu es toujours aussi belle.

English: I don't see any damage.
French: Je ne vois aucun dommage.

English: Buying a new TV won't make you happy.
French: Acheter une nouvelle télé ne te rendra pas heureuse.

English: Have you finished breakfast yet?
French: Avez-vous déjà fini le petit-déjeuner ?

English: I handled it.
French: Je m'en suis occupé.

English: French has many more vowels than Japanese.
French: Le français a beaucoup plus de voyelles que le japonais.

English: Tom thought that Mary was asleep.
French: Tom pensait que Mary était endormie.

English: I don't know why you're all so upset.
French: J'ignore pourquoi vous êtes toutes tellement contrariées.

English: That's fun.
French: C'est amusant.

English: Your story is hard to believe.
French: Ton histoire est difficile à croire.

English: Let him do as he likes.
French: Laissez-le faire comme il le désire.

English: A calamity was avoided by sheer luck.
French: Une calamité a été évitée par pure chance.

English: Don't sing.
French: Ne chante pas.

English: I thought you might be upset.
French: Je pensais que vous pourriez être contrariés.

English: You've lost some weight, haven't you?
French: Tu as maigri, n'est-ce pas?

English: You have to stay fit.
French: Tu dois garder la forme.

English: I thought you'd never get here.
French: Je pensais que tu n'arriverais jamais ici.

English: Eat your veggies.
French: Mange tes légumes !

English: Tom certainly knows a lot of French.
French: Tom connaît certainement beaucoup de choses françaises.

English: You seem happy.
French: Tu sembles heureux.

English: Tom is now three months old.
French: Tom vient d'avoir trois mois.

English: It's obvious that you're wrong.
French: Il est évident que vous avez tort.

English: Hey, what's this?
French: Eh, c'est quoi ?

English: I seldom go to the movies.
French: Je vais rarement au cinéma.

English: You're very helpful.
French: Vous êtes fort serviables.

English: Tom is always sleeping.
French: Tom dort toujours.

English: I don't know how to make you happy.
French: J'ignore comment vous rendre heureuses.

English: I didn't think you'd leave so early.
French: Je ne pensais pas que tu partirais si tôt.

English: My grandpa believes that the moon landing was a hoax.
French: Mon pépé croit que l'atterrissage sur la Lune était un canular.

English: Get back to the ship.
French: Retournez au bateau !

English: I've done that all my life.
French: J'ai fait ça toute ma vie.

English: What did you do at that moment?
French: Que faisiez-vous au juste à ce moment-là ?

English: The army has advanced to the river.
French: L'armée a progressé jusqu'à la rivière.

English: No passengers were hurt.
French: Aucun passager ne fut blessé.

English: Are any seats still available?
French: Des places sont-elles encore disponibles ?

English: I didn't even know you spoke French.
French: J'ignorais même que tu parlais français.

English: What do you want to do after you graduate?
French: Que voulez-vous faire après que vous aurez été diplômées ?

English: Were you even tempted?
French: As-tu même été tenté ?

English: You didn't need to come so early.
French: Vous n'aviez pas besoin de venir si tôt.

English: There's no shortage of work.
French: Ce n'est pas le travail qui manque.

English: The water was cold.
French: L'eau était froide.

English: It's not as bad as it sounds.
French: Ce n'est pas si mauvais que cela parait.

English: She was a beauty in her day.
French: C'était une beauté dans sa jeunesse.

English: I just cracked a rib.
French: Je viens de me fêler une côte.

English: They told me about it.
French: Elles m'en ont parlé.

English: It is no good to you.
French: Ça ne vous fait pas de bien.

English: That will be all for today.
French: Ce sera tout pour aujourd'hui.

English: Where is the bus stop for the museum?
French: Où se trouve l'arrêt de bus pour le musée ?

English: Let me think it over, and I'll let you know later.
French: Laisse-moi y réfléchir et je te le ferai savoir plus tard.

English: My sister is too young to go to school.
French: Ma sœur est trop jeune pour aller à l'école.

English: I can carry those suitcases for you.
French: Je peux porter ces valises pour vous.

English: Not every student has a dictionary.
French: Tous les élèves n'ont pas de dictionnaires.

English: I'm waiting for your help.
French: J'attends ton aide.

English: Why won't my dog eat dog food?
French: Pourquoi mon chien refuse-t-il de manger de la nourriture pour chien ?

English: I thought doing this would be easy, but we've been working all day and we're still not finished.
French: Je pensais que faire cela serait facile, mais nous avons travaillé toute la journée et nous n'avons pas encore terminé.

English: I want a massage. I need to relax.
French: J’ai envie d’un massage. J'ai besoin de me détendre.

English: You're not often wrong.
French: Vous n'avez pas souvent tort.

English: There are some differences between British English and American English.
French: Il y a des différences entre l'anglais britannique et l'anglais américain.

English: Tom only had eyes for Mary.
French: Tom n'avait d'yeux que pour Marie.

English: This is not a trap.
French: Ce n'est pas un piège.

English: You must tell me.
French: Il te faut me le dire.

English: Is this really happening?
French: Est-ce vraiment en train de se passer ?

English: Foxes have few natural predators.
French: Le renard a peu de prédateurs naturels.

English: You chose a good one.
French: Vous en avez choisi un bon.

English: This music is making me sleepy.
French: Cette musique m'endort.

English: What language do you usually use when talking with Tom?
French: Tu parles en quelle langue avec Tom, d’habitude ?

English: Just do what you've got to do.
French: Fais juste ce que tu as à faire.

English: Tom is very smart.
French: Tom est très intelligent.

English: The problem is solved.
French: Le problème est réglé.

English: You enjoyed that, didn't you?
French: Vous avez apprécié cela, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I've never worked this hard before.
French: Je n'ai jamais travaillé si dur auparavant.

English: May I call on you at your house tomorrow morning?
French: Puis-je vous rendre visite à votre domicile, demain matin ?

English: Let's have fun.
French: Amusons-nous.

English: He pretended to be asleep.
French: Il a feint d'être endormi.

English: Please wait around for a while.
French: Attendez ici un moment s'il vous plaît.

English: Do you hit your children?
French: Frappez-vous vos enfants ?

English: I like to sing.
French: J’aime chanter.

English: I never knew my father.
French: Je n'ai jamais connu mon père.

English: You're in the right place.
French: Tu es au bon endroit.

English: I'm not happy about the situation.
French: Je ne suis pas heureux de la situation.

English: You're confused again, aren't you?
French: Vous vous embrouillez à nouveau, non ?

English: All of your accusations are without foundation. She's innocent and we're going to prove it.
French: Toutes vos accusations sont sans fondement, elle est innocente et nous le prouverons !

English: I really like you a lot.
French: Je vous apprécie vraiment beaucoup.

English: He's a total wreck.
French: C'est une vraie loque.

English: Tell me you're kidding.
French: Dites-moi que vous plaisantez !

English: All the old magazines are sold out.
French: Tous les vieux magazines sont épuisés.

English: I can see his hand in this.
French: Je reconnais là son œuvre.

English: He rolled his eyes.
French: Il roula des yeux.

English: Ring the bell.
French: Sonnez la cloche.

English: We're all on the same team.
French: Nous appartenons tous à la même équipe.

English: Can we fix this?
French: Pouvons-nous réparer ça ?

English: I just don't want to see you get disappointed.
French: Je ne veux pas vous voir être déçues, un point c'est tout.

English: We made friends with them.
French: Nous avons sympathisé avec elles.

English: It is getting dark outdoors.
French: Il se fait sombre dehors.

English: That's good news to me.
French: C'est une bonne nouvelle pour moi.

English: I don't care who your father is. You still have to follow my orders.
French: Je me fiche de savoir qui est ton père. Tu dois quand même obéir à mes ordres.

English: We had to call off the game because of rain.
French: Nous dûmes annuler la partie à cause de la pluie.

English: I was disappointed.
French: J'étais déçue.

English: Let me introduce you to my wife.
French: Laissez-moi vous présenter ma femme.

English: It's not right.
French: Ce n'est pas exact.

English: I have a ton of work to do today.
French: J'ai une tonne de travail à faire, aujourd'hui.

English: I'm going to the country with my friends.
French: Je vais à la campagne avec mes amis.

English: Don't drink too much, okay?

English: I was chosen for that.

English: He is immediately above me in rank.

English: Tom doesn't laugh very often.

English: They relaxed on the beach.

English: Can you tell me the time?

French: Après le déjeuner, nous sommes allés faire du patinage.

English: I think I broke his heart.

English: I suppose that's all right.

English: You're in danger, Tom.

English: There's nothing more to say.

English: She went into teaching.

English: Was Tom there?

English: I think I'd better call Tom.

English: I feel kind of hungry.

English: I have books that I've reread several times.

English: I've never seen you so happy.

English: Don't they drive you mad?

English: We're expecting a lot of people to attend the ceremony.

English: You don't look happy.

English: I don't know when I'll be able to pay you back the money I owe you.

English: That's a very interesting theory.

English: He's not worthy of you.

English: Go outside.

English: Tom's room is always neat.

English: Tom turned off the faucet.

English: Tom is your husband's middle name, isn't it?

English: Frogs turn into princes only in fairy tales.

English: I have to wait.

English: May I help you? "No, thank you. I'm just looking."
French: « Puis-je vous aider ? » « Non, merci. Je ne fais que regarder. »

English: Have you ever tried it?

English: I understand completely.

English: He keeps on asking me for money.

English: I'll be happy to help you.

English: I swear I've never hurt Tom.

English: There is no connection between them.

English: Have you ever seen a spider spinning its web?

English: My uncle isn't young, but he's healthy.
French: Mon oncle n'est pas jeune, mais il est en bonne santé.

English: Can I help you find something?

English: Tom gave Mary the picture.

English: What's that red stuff?

English: I think we'd better get out of here.

English: I can't go to work in these clothes.

English: As is often the case with him, he was late again.

English: I like your costume.

English: I'm taking it with me.

English: I've upset you.

English: You're to blame.

English: Tom has a horse.

English: No one made you do anything.

English: What did they hit you with?

English: Hippopotamuses love water.

English: I have a lot of assignments to do today.

English: I understand what you mean, but I'm not sure how to translate it.

English: I was a teacher for fifteen years.

English: The meeting was just about over.

English: She's sitting in the kitchen and drinking tea.

English: Don't tell anyone this.

English: You raise a good point.

English: Tom has a history of arrests for drunken driving.

English: She was wearing a blue coat.

English: I can't forget about that stupid movie.

English: It's a travesty.

English: It's anybody's guess who will win the next race.

English: Dad painted the walls white.

English: Tom loves potatoes.

English: You'd better take an umbrella with you.

English: I have something I have to tell you.

English: Many people in Africa were killed as a result of the storm.

English: I'm not supposed to help you.

English: It's pretty hot.

English: I know my keys are here somewhere.

English: I'm beautiful.

English: Can you supply me with all I need?

English: No one had anything left to say.

English: You were useless.

English: Why is everyone crying?

English: She asked him for some money.

English: This is the worst book I've ever read.

English: Don't leave your stuff behind.

English: She has a kind heart.

English: I am undressing.

English: When did you become a teacher?

English: Is there a zoo in Boston?

English: If two people have the same opinion, one of them is redundant.
French: Si deux personnes ont la même opinion, l'une d'elles est inutile.

English: The most beloved people in the world are the spontaneous.
French: Les gens les plus chéris au monde sont les gens spontanés.

English: Why are you picking a fight with me?

English: That's not acceptable.

English: We discussed the problem for a long time.

English: It's like one of those.

English: Tom is out of danger.

English: Tom opened the safe.

English: My girlfriend is crying.

English: I suppose you won't mind if I take one.

English: I think we should stop doing that.

English: We have been enjoying peace for more than 40 years.

English: I'll keep it a secret. Don't worry.

English: Don't you recognize that guy?

English: Is there anything new?

English: How did you change your clothes so quickly?

English: I thought he had died.

English: Tom has a soft voice.

English: We don't want you to hurt yourself.

English: Buying a new TV won't make you happy.

English: They're armed.

English: Tom will be absent today because he has a cold.

English: There is a rotating restaurant at the top of this tower.

English: How does that make you feel?

English: You have a lovely daughter.

English: I said this a long time ago.

English: I know that Tom did that once.

English: Why can't you be more like your brother?

French: Ne vous en faites pas ! Nous obtiendrons l'argent.

English: He pointed to the tower over there.

English: He's not available.

English: Did you sign?

English: I believe the answer is yes.

English: This is not about money.

English: That's very sweet of you.

English: He was a fresh face in American politics.

English: Nobody in my family can do that.

English: By the way, do you play the violin?

English: You don't need a list.

English: Why do you not believe in God?

English: I ran upstairs.

English: What's your shoe size?

French: Passer du temps avec ta bien-aimée devrait être en tête de ta liste de priorités.

English: If you have the time, come along with me.

English: Is there anyone else?

English: Is that all you bought?

English: Why did you guys break up?

English: They'll all be here tonight.

English: I want to be certain you are who you say you are.

English: Are you content with your position in the company?

English: That's the woman who wants to see you.

English: The shortage of manpower poses a big problem for us.

English: Do you think he's really into me?

English: Meanwhile, you can stay with us.

English: Don't judge people by their appearance.

English: Tom seemed calm.

English: Yours is not bad, either.

English: She seems to be involved in that murder case.

French: Je te conseillerais fortement de faire ce que le patron t'a dit de faire.

English: How many hours is the flight?

English: He will always be with you.

English: That was a problem.

English: I hope you'll find this office satisfactory.

English: They are Russian.

English: Is that milk still good?

English: You won't find it in there.

English: It is time for you to go to bed.
French: C'est l'heure pour toi d'aller au lit.

English: Tom has been expelled from school.
French: Tom a été renvoyé de l'école.

English: I had to get out of the house.
French: J'ai dû sortir de la maison.

English: Are we done here?

English: Are you a registered voter?

English: Let me tell you how Tom and Mary met.
French: Laisse-moi te dire comment Tom et Mary se sont rencontrés.

English: Why are you interested?
French: Pourquoi êtes-vous intéressés ?

English: It was surprising that she said that.
French: Il était surprenant qu'elle ait dit ça.

English: You're a very gifted artist.
French: Vous êtes un artiste très doué.

English: The sun rises in the morning.
French: Le soleil se lève au matin.

English: Thanks for taking care of all of this.
French: Merci de gérer tout ceci.

English: This makes me very happy.
French: Ça me rend très heureux.

English: Bring me the phone, Tom.
French: Donne-moi le téléphone, Tom.

English: I'd like a little help.
French: J'aimerais un peu d'aide.

English: Are you sure it's impossible?
French: Est-ce que tu es sure que c'est impossible ?

English: I don't like beer that much.
French: Je n'aime pas tant que ça la bière.

English: Did you do that purposely?

English: He can stay here for one night, no longer.
French: Il peut rester ici pour une nuit, pas plus.

English: Some believe Nessie lives in this lake.
French: Certains croient que Nessie vit dans ce lac.

English: How much have you made tonight?

English: I'm not a saint.

English: It is no good to you.

English: What vegetables do you usually grow?

English: We remained silent.
French: Nous sommes restées silencieuses.

English: Let me handle this.

English: They're out to get you.

English: She waited for you for two hours.
French: Elle vous a attendu pendant deux heures.

English: Have you ever eaten at this restaurant?
French: As-tu jamais mangé dans ce restaurant-ci ?

English: You can have either of these, but not both.
French: Tu peux avoir l'un ou l'autre, mais pas les deux.

English: This is a pencil.
French: Ceci est un crayon.

English: I made that one.
French: J'ai fait celle-là.

English: I've found another job.
French: J'ai trouvé un autre travail.

English: It may rain soon.
French: Il semble qu'il va pleuvoir bientôt.

English: Tom doesn't have any money on him.
French: Tom n'a pas d'argent sur lui.

English: You're not a morning person, are you?
French: Tu n'es pas du matin, hein ?

English: She is always dressed in black.
French: Elle est toujours habillée en noir.

English: Is there anyone else around?
French: Y a-t-il qui que ce soit d'autre dans le coin ?

English: There was no one else on the road.
French: Il n'y avait personne d'autre sur la route.

English: We like doing things our own way.
French: Nous aimons faire les choses à notre manière.

English: I just don't want to catch your cold.

English: Let me be the judge of that.

English: Many Americans are interested in jazz.
French: De nombreux Américains s'intéressent au Jazz.

English: I have eaten a lot this morning.
French: J'ai beaucoup mangé ce matin.

English: Haiti is a nation that seems hopelessly impoverished.
French: Haïti est une nation qui parait désespérément appauvrie.

English: Are things OK with you?

English: I asked him not to drive so fast.

English: I'd like to come along.

English: I didn't say it wasn't OK to eat.

English: I'm obviously very disappointed.

English: I don't read.

English: Her anger was genuine.

English: Is there someone with you?
French: Y a-t-il quelqu'un avec vous ?

English: I thought they wouldn't like you.
French: Je pensais qu'ils ne vous apprécieraient pas.

English: It's easy to make and it's cheap.
French: C'est facile à faire et c'est bon marché.

English: I've already done the hard part.
French: J'ai déjà fait la portion difficile.

English: I parked on the street in front of your house.
French: Je me suis garé sur la rue en face de ta maison.

English: I never wanted that.

English: He has a generous nature.
French: Il est de nature généreuse.

English: They all look the same.

English: All share the blame.

English: I've had a lot of fun so far.
French: Je me suis beaucoup amusé jusqu'à présent.

English: Is this your girlfriend?

English: Place it wherever you like.
French: Mets-le où ça te chante.

English: Was there much damage?

English: He knows better than to believe such a thing.
French: Il n'est pas bête au point de croire à une chose pareille.

English: He was wounded in a burglary.

English: He gladly accepted our offer.
French: Il a volontiers accepté notre proposition.

English: Stop acting like a child.
French: Cesse de te conduire comme un enfant !

English: Have you told everyone when and where the meeting will be?
French: Avez-vous dit à tout le monde quand et où la réunion se tiendra ?

English: Tom couldn't answer the last question.
French: Tom ne pouvait pas répondre à la dernière question.

English: You might as well go kill yourself.
French: Tu peux tout aussi bien aller te pendre.

English: All the buses are full.

English: You'll be all right.
French: Ça va très bien aller pour vous.

English: You go first.
French: Vous en premier.

English: I didn't know Tom had died.
French: Je ne savais pas que Tom était mort.

English: They wanted to know what happened.
French: Ils voulaient savoir ce qui était arrivé.

English: My brother hung the picture upside down.
French: Mon frère a accroché le tableau à l'envers.

English: You don't have to eat it.
French: Tu n'es pas obligé de le manger.

English: What do you intend to do about that?

English: Tom doesn't know what Mary means when she says that.
French: Tom ne sait pas ce que Marie veut dire quand elle dit cela.

English: We have no hot water because the pipes broke.
French: Nous ne disposons pas d'eau chaude car les tuyaux ont rompu.

English: Why aren't you studying French?
French: Pourquoi n'étudies-tu pas le français ?

English: He is taller than any other boy in his class.
French: Il est plus grand que tout autre garçon de sa classe.

English: They live on the floor beneath.

English: I can't believe I'm here again.

English: People are more educated now than they used to be.
French: Les gens sont plus éduqués qu'ils ne l'étaient avant.

English: It fell short of my expectation.
French: Ce ne fut pas à la mesure de mes attentes.

English: Tom read the letter.
French: Tom lut la lettre.

English: When did you get there?

English: My boy can't do addition properly yet.
French: Mon garçon ne sait pas encore faire correctement les additions.

English: Do this work by tomorrow if at all possible.
French: Fais ce travail pour demain si c'est dans le domaine du possible.

English: Just sign here.
French: Signez juste ici.

English: Are you a high school student?
French: Êtes-vous lycéen ?

English: Whose kid is that?

English: I bet you're a great teacher.
French: Je parie que vous êtes un excellent professeur.

English: I was eighteen then.

English: We can't let them do that.
French: Nous ne pouvons les laisser faire cela.

English: Can I use your telephone?
French: Puis-je utiliser ton téléphone ?

English: You aren't in a hurry, are you?
French: Tu n'es pas pressée, si ?

English: Cuban soldiers were guarding the streets.
French: Les soldats cubains gardaient les rues.

English: She tied him up.
French: Elle le ligota.

English: My new job leaves me little time to socialize.
French: Mon nouvel emploi me laisse peu de temps pour rencontrer des gens.

English: You're not the only Canadian here.
French: Vous n'êtes pas le seul canadien ici.

English: I felt guilty.

English: The moon is out.
French: La lune est visible.

English: You're on the wrong ship.
French: Tu es sur le mauvais bateau.

English: Are there any books under the desk?
French: Y a-t-il quelque livre sous le bureau ?

English: In autumn the leaves turn yellow.
French: En automne, le feuillage devient jaune.

English: We're all being manipulated.
French: Nous sommes toutes en train d'être manipulées.

English: Can I have the paper when you're finished with it?

English: Are you sure you saw someone on the bridge?
French: Êtes-vous sûre d'avoir vu quelqu'un sur le pont ?

English: Where's your watch?

English: They don't listen to me.

English: Never forget to lock the door.
French: N'oubliez jamais de verrouiller la porte.

English: Your criticism is unfair.

English: I feel like I'm going mad.
French: J'ai l'impression de devenir fou.

English: We have to get you to a hospital.
French: Nous devons t'emmener à un hôpital.

English: Don't let Tom do that.
French: Ne laisse pas Tom faire ça.

English: I don't know why it didn't work.
French: Je ne sais pas pourquoi cela n'a pas marché.

English: I'm still not sure.
French: Je ne suis toujours pas sûr.

English: What time did you close the store last night?
French: À quelle heure as-tu fermé la boutique la nuit dernière ?

English: She pushed him out the door.
French: Elle le poussa par la porte.

English: She had already gone to bed when I called her at 11 p.m.
French: Elle était déjà allée se coucher quand je lui ai téléphoné à 23 h.

English: At the next intersection, take a right.
French: À la prochaine intersection, piquez à droite.

English: There are holes in the roof.
French: Il y a des trous dans le toit.

English: The ice sheets are melting.

English: Get the box.
French: Prenez la boîte.

English: I know how to fly.
French: Je sais voler.

English: Tom already knows the truth.
French: Tom sait déjà la vérité.

English: Can I begin?
French: Puis-je commencer ?

English: You shouldn't talk about people behind their backs.
French: Vous ne devriez pas parler des gens dans leur dos.

English: What don't you have?
French: Que n'as-tu pas ?

English: You're not my friend.
French: Tu n'es pas mon ami.

English: You'd better not go out today.
French: Vous feriez mieux de ne pas sortir aujourd'hui.

English: I had no idea where I was.
French: Je n'avais aucune idée d'où j'étais.

English: What do you spend most of your time doing?
French: Que fais-tu, la plupart du temps ?

English: If I were you, I'd buy it.
French: Si j'étais vous, je l'acquerrais.

English: I slept very well last night.
French: J'ai fort bien dormi la nuit passée.

English: We have a deadline.
French: Nous avons une échéance.

English: I am so busy that I can't help you.
French: Je suis tellement occupé que je ne peux pas t'aider.

English: Of the three boys, the youngest is the most attractive.
French: Des trois enfants, c'est le plus jeune le plus attirant.

English: You're going to be late again.
French: Tu vas encore être en retard.

English: You've been very kind to me.
French: Tu as été très gentille avec moi.

English: Can you guess what I have?

English: I have complete faith in my doctor.
French: J'ai une entière confiance en mon médecin.

English: I loved it.
French: J'adorais ça.

English: You had a week to finish this.
French: Tu avais une semaine pour finir ceci.

English: Tom is much fatter than Mary.
French: Tom est bien plus gros que Marie.

English: I managed to finish the work.
French: Je parvins à achever le travail.

English: I didn't need your help.
French: Je n'avais pas besoin de votre aide.

English: It's a very delicate subject.

English: Take the chair to your room.
French: Emmène la chaise dans ta chambre.

English: I think we should talk about this later.
French: Je pense que nous devrions en parler plus tard.

English: Excuse me, could I get past?
French: Excusez-moi, pourrais-je passer ?

English: Tom is going to learn how to do that sooner or later.
French: Tom apprendra un jour ou l'autre comment le faire.

English: Where were you last night?
French: Où étais-tu la nuit dernière ?

English: I'll try to contact Tom.
French: J'essayerai de contacter Tom.

English: This river is very deep.
French: Cette rivière est très profonde.

English: I'm sorry I dragged you into this.
French: Je suis désolée de vous avoir entraîné là-dedans.

English: When you meet someone for the first time, be careful about how close you stand to that person.
French: Lorsque vous rencontrez une personne pour la première fois, soyez attentive à la distance à laquelle vous vous tenez d'elle.

English: I found you.
French: Je t'ai trouvé.

English: I want to know how this happened and why.
French: Je veux savoir comment c'est arrivé et pourquoi.

English: I can't tell you how much I've been looking forward to your visit.
French: Je ne peux pas te dire combien j'attendais ta visite avec impatience.

English: I'd rather die than give you this.
French: J'aimerais mieux mourir plutôt que vous le donner.

English: Why wouldn't you let me tell you what happened?
French: Pourquoi ne me laissez-vous pas vous conter ce qui est arrivé ?

English: Where on earth did you go last night?
French: Mais où es-tu donc allée la nuit dernière ?

English: He became a national hero.
French: Il est devenu un héros national.

English: He was holding a pen in his hand.
French: Il tenait un stylo dans la main.

English: I love trying new things.
French: J'adore essayer de nouveaux trucs.

English: I liked your speech.
French: J'ai aimé votre discours.

English: They're lying.
French: Elles mentent.

English: Tom is learning to swim.
French: Tom apprend à nager.

English: The child's nose is bleeding.
French: Le gosse saigne du nez.

English: You have to come.
French: Tu dois venir.

English: No one complained.
French: Personne ne s'est plaint.

English: Were you born there?
French: Es-tu né là-bas ?

English: Do you think the road is wide enough for cars?

English: We want Tom to sing with us.
French: Nous voulons que Tom chante avec nous.

English: What are you going to do tonight?

English: Do you like to be kept waiting?

English: Try to be more punctual from now on.
French: Essayez d'être plus ponctuels, désormais.

English: Don't thank me. Thank Tom.
French: Ne me remercie pas. Remercie Tom.

English: Don't blame me.
French: Je n'y suis pour rien.

English: Why was Tom fired?
French: Pourquoi Tom a-t-il été viré ?

English: Tom likes to go to the beach.
French: Tom aime aller à la plage.

English: Tom left his kids at home.
French: Tom a laissé ses enfants à la maison.

English: My sister will have been studying English for ten years when she graduates from her college.
French: Ma sœur aura étudié l'anglais durant dix ans quand elle obtiendra son diplôme de l'université.

English: Does your school have a library?
French: Ton école dispose-t-elle d'une bibliothèque ?

English: You should be ashamed of yourselves.
French: Vous devriez avoir honte de vous.

English: Tom's guilty.
French: Tom est coupable.

English: I'm no one special.
French: Je ne suis personne de spécial.

English: Is he dead?

English: I used to be your age.

English: He nudged me to go ahead.
French: Il me poussa du coude à poursuivre.

English: I'd like to explain this in a little more detail.

English: She put some of the ointment on her hands.
French: Elle mit de la pommade sur ses mains.

English: Let me explain the rules.

English: I want you to know what really happened.
French: Je veux que tu saches ce qui s'est réellement produit.

English: Let's do this properly.

English: I don't think he's playing with a full deck.

English: I think we've got enough money to buy everything we need.

English: Tell me why you think that.

English: Help me out here.

English: Let's meet on Sunday.

English: I don't want people to hate me.
French: Je ne veux pas que les gens me haïssent.

English: Fortunately, the weather was good.
French: Heureusement, le temps était beau.

English: Let's not split hairs.

English: Last night there was a fire near here, and I couldn't sleep.
French: La nuit dernière, il y a eu un incendie et je n'ai pas pu dormir.

English: I need to make a few calls.
French: Il me faut passer quelques appels.

English: I was fortunate to find a good job.
French: J'ai eu la chance de trouver un bon boulot.

English: He's not my cousin.

English: You need to save the princess.
French: Il te faut sauver la princesse.

English: You have to give me more time.
French: Vous devez me donner plus de temps.

English: I can't find Tom anywhere.

English: I'm not sure that that's true.

English: I've already considered that.

English: She was advised by him to be punctual.
French: Il lui conseilla de se montrer ponctuelle.

English: I'm not going to study French anymore.

English: Do you think students are given enough time to eat lunch?

English: She cut her hand with a knife.
French: Elle s'est coupé la main avec un couteau.

English: Tom anonymously donated a million dollars to his favorite charity.
French: Tom a donné, anonymement, un million de dollars à son organisation caritative préférée.

English: She advised him to take a rest.
French: Elle lui conseilla de prendre du repos.

English: She's not a bad girl.

English: Do I curse too much?

English: Did you know that the crane is a migratory bird and that it can lift up to one hundred kilograms?
French: Savais-tu que la grue était un oiseau migrateur et qu'elle pouvait porter jusqu'à cent kilogrammes ?

English: I usually get up at six.
French: Je me lève usuellement à six heures.

English: These are fresh.

English: I have to try.

English: Tom was so hungry that he ate dog food.
French: Tom avait si faim qu'il mangea de la nourriture pour chien.

English: I'd like a word with Tom.

English: Doing something only half-heartedly is the worst thing you can do.
French: Faire quelque chose nonchalamment est la pire chose que tu puisses faire.

English: Guess what I did last night.

English: Tom is taking a walk.
French: Tom fait une promenade.

English: I go to school only three days a week.
French: Je ne me rends à l'école que trois jours par semaine.

English: A dog suddenly jumped at me.

English: It was the great lung-power of Caruso that made him a great singer.
French: C'était la grande capacité pulmonaire de Caruso qui en a fait un grand chanteur.

English: I don't care who's coming.

English: Where does this train go?

English: I'd like to talk to you when you have some free time.
French: J'aimerais m'entretenir avec toi, lorsque tu auras du temps disponible.

English: I want to do that with Tom.
French: J'ai envie de faire ça avec Tom.

English: You've been a great help.
French: Tu as été d'une grande aide.

English: That's all you need to know.
French: C'est tout ce qu'il te faut savoir.

English: I know a good place for dinner.
French: Je connais un bon endroit pour dîner.

English: This town hasn't changed much in the last ten years.
French: Cette ville n'a pas beaucoup changé au cours des dix dernières années.

English: You may stay here if you like, as long as you keep quiet.
French: Vous pouvez rester ici si vous voulez, aussi longtemps que vous restez tranquilles.

English: The manufacturer guaranteed the new machine for 5 years.
French: Le fabricant garantit la nouvelle machine pour cinq ans.

English: I know that Tom did that for us.
French: Je sais que Tom l'a fait pour nous.

English: We'll meet at my house.
French: Nous nous verrons chez moi.

English: The room was quiet.
French: Il n'y avait pas un bruit dans la pièce.

English: You're no longer allowed to speak.
French: Vous n'êtes plus autorisés à parler.

English: You don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.
French: Vous n'êtes pas obligée d'en parler si vous ne voulez pas.

English: Let me explain it with a diagram.
French: Je vous explique avec un schéma.

English: 67% of those who never smoked said they worried about the health effects of passive smoking.
French: 67% de ceux qui n'ont jamais fumé ont dit qu'ils s'inquiétaient des effets sur la santé de la fumée passive.

English: What do you consider your greatest achievement?
French: Que considères-tu comme ta plus grande réussite ?

English: Phew! That was close!
French: Ouf ! Il était grand temps !

English: I don't recall saying that.
French: Je ne me rappelle pas avoir dit ça.

English: Tom is just like you.
French: Tom est tout simplement comme toi.

English: I like watermelon.
French: J'aime la pastèque.

English: I can't carry a tune.
French: Je ne sais pas chanter juste.

English: Do you have a pet?
French: Avez-vous un animal domestique ?

English: Who forced you to do that?
French: Qui vous a forcé à faire cela ?

English: She is herself again.
French: Elle est à nouveau elle-même.

English: I'll never forget your kindness as long as I live.
French: Je n'oublierai jamais votre gentillesse, aussi longtemps que je vivrai.

English: If you want to be happy, make somebody else happy.
French: Si vous voulez être heureux, rendez quelqu'un d'autre heureux.

English: I'm not going to get involved.
French: Je ne vais pas m'impliquer.

English: Do you speak French, too?
French: Parles-tu aussi français ?

English: She introduced me to her brother.
French: Elle m'a présenté à son frère.

English: I want to make her happy.
French: Je veux la rendre heureuse.

English: I'm proud of that.
French: Je suis fière de cela.

English: Before I knew it, I couldn't see the birds.
French: Le temps de me rendre compte, je ne pouvais plus voir les oiseaux.

English: I got this job with my teacher's help.
French: J'ai obtenu cet emploi avec l'aide de mon professeur.

English: I've got to get back home by midnight.
French: Je dois être rentré chez moi pour minuit.

English: Don't talk about yourself like that.
French: Ne parle pas de toi ainsi !

English: Why are you yelling?
French: Pourquoi est-ce que tu cries ?

English: I got the engine going.
French: J'ai fait démarrer le moteur.

English: When did this come about?
French: Quand est-ce survenu ?

English: It was Tom that saved the girl.
French: C'est Tom qui a sauvé cette fille.

English: I can't stand staying indoors.
French: Je ne supporte pas de rester enfermé.

English: Tom is just joking.
French: Tom plaisante simplement.

English: We're all scared.
French: Nous avons toutes peur.

English: I cannot thank you enough for your kindness.
French: Je ne te remercierai jamais assez pour ta gentillesse.

English: The baby is asleep.
French: Le bébé dort.

English: My parents wouldn't understand.
French: Mes parents ne comprendraient pas.

English: I made a sandwich for you.
French: Je vous ai fait un sandwich.

English: Since my mother was sick, I couldn't leave the house last Saturday.
French: Comme ma mère était malade, je n'ai pas pu quitter la maison samedi passé.

English: You're drunk.
French: Vous êtes saoul.

English: I wanted to talk to you about something.
French: Je voulais te parler de quelque chose.

English: Are you sure you can handle this?
French: Êtes-vous sûre de pouvoir gérer ceci ?

English: Do you know where I live?
French: Est-ce que tu sais où j'habite ?

English: My heart is pounding so hard it feels like it's going to explode.
French: Mon cœur bat tellement fort qu'il semble vouloir éclater.

English: I hate myself.
French: Je me déteste.

English: It's 99.9% effective.
French: C'est efficace à quatre-vingt-dix-neuf virgule neuf pour cent.

English: Drop the gun.
French: Lâche l'arme !

English: Can you beat that?
French: Peux-tu battre ça ?

English: I don't care what people think.
French: Je n'ai cure de ce que les gens pensent.

English: I'll leave you to it.
French: Je te laisse t'en occuper.

English: She will come even if she is tired.
French: Elle viendra même si elle est fatiguée.

English: I have something you want.
French: J'ai quelque chose que tu veux.

English: I didn't know you had a cat.
French: J'ignorais que tu avais un chat.

English: I feel like such an idiot.
French: Je me sens tellement idiote.

English: She saw me enter the store.
French: Elle m'a vu pénétrer dans le magasin.

English: I'm reluctant to help Tom.
French: Je suis réticente à aider Tom.

English: It's like one of those.
French: C'est similaire à l'un de ceux-là.

English: I like classical music.
French: J'aime la musique classique.

English: I know what you know.
French: Je sais ce que tu sais.

English: Tom is being held prisoner.
French: Tom est emprisonné.

English: Tom has decided to become a pilot.
French: Tom a décidé de devenir pilote.

English: Which student went out?
French: Quel étudiant est sorti ?

English: On arriving home, I discovered the burglary.
French: En arrivant à la maison, j'ai découvert le cambriolage.

English: I held onto the rope for as long as I could, but I finally had to let go.
French: J'ai agrippé la corde aussi longtemps que j'ai pu, mais j'ai finalement dû la lâcher.

English: Tom slept all day.
French: Tom a dormi toute la journée.

English: She met her uncle at the shop.
French: Elle rencontra son oncle dans le magasin.

English: You can get from Washington to New York by train.
French: Vous pouvez vous rendre de Washington à New York en train.

English: Is your new computer working well?
French: Ton nouvel ordinateur marche bien ?

English: I waited a month.
French: J'ai attendu un mois.

English: I just don't want to see you get disappointed.
French: Je ne veux tout simplement pas te voir être déçue.

English: You're grumpy.
French: Vous êtes bougon.

English: I do apologize.
French: Je présente vraiment mes excuses.

English: He's not in.
French: Il n'est pas chez lui.

English: It's a little complicated.
French: C'est un peu compliqué.

English: What have I told you?
French: Que t'ai-je dit ?

English: It's one thing to make plans, but quite another to carry them out.
French: C'est une chose de faire des projets, c'en est une autre de les réaliser.

English: The girls had a catfight.
French: Les filles se sont crêpé le chignon.

English: Last night we worked until 10 p.m.
French: Hier soir nous avons travaillé jusqu'à dix heures.

English: I like singing and playing the guitar.
French: J'aime chanter et jouer de la guitare.

English: The situation went from bad to worse.
French: La situation allait de pire en pire.

English: You'll want to look your best tomorrow.
French: Tu voudras avoir l'air à ton maximum, demain.

English: How do you know it's real?
French: Comment savez-vous que c'est vrai ?

English: I can't eat that food.
French: Je ne peux pas manger cette nourriture.

English: This is your key.
French: C'est ta clef.

English: He's always asking silly questions.
French: Il pose tout le temps des questions idiotes.

English: I'm not even a little surprised.
French: Je ne suis même pas un peu surpris.

English: I was working last night.
French: Je travaillais la nuit dernière.

English: It's still snowing in Boston.
French: Il neige toujours à Boston.

English: I can't stand his arrogance.

English: This didn't cost anything.
