English: They love their kids.
French: Elles adorent leurs enfants.

English: If we had more money, we'd do that.
French: Si nous avions plus d'argent, nous le ferions.

English: Can you understand Tom?

English: This is between you and me.
French: C'est entre toi et moi.

English: Our house was built in 2013.
French: Notre maison a été construite en 2013.

English: I must remind you about your promise.

English: We may as well start at once.

English: You're no saint.

English: She gave him a massage.
French: Elle lui fit un massage.

English: Do you like French wines?
French: Aimez-vous les vins français ?

English: My father never gave me much advice.

English: I have no food.

English: Didn't it ever occur to them that they would be punished?

English: You're done working, aren't you?

English: I am feeling sad about it.

English: Your singing would put a professional singer to shame.

English: That's not a museum.

English: I can't do it.

English: She often goes to the movies with him.
French: Elle va souvent au cinéma avec lui.

English: Is there a problem I should know about?

English: You're lost.

English: Which way are you going?
French: De quel côté vas-tu ?

English: It's not necessary to come tomorrow.
French: Il n'est pas nécessaire de venir demain.

English: Who's going to believe Tom?

English: My faith in the next generation is increasing.
French: Ma confiance dans la prochaine génération croit.

English: She plays Bach.

English: You must always keep your hands clean.
French: Vous devez toujours garder les mains propres.

English: You are no longer welcome here.

English: Don't use your real name.

English: You may invite whoever you like.

English: You put too much stuff in your wallet.

English: Tom most certainly would not approve.

English: I want you to get off my back.

English: How can you be so blind?

English: What kind of a sick joke is this?

English: We're perfectly safe here.
French: Nous sommes parfaitement en sécurité, ici.

English: Ten years have passed since he died.
French: Dix ans sont passés depuis qu'il est mort.

English: She is knitting a scarf.
French: Elle tricote une écharpe.

English: Nothing is more important than empathy.
French: Rien n'est plus important que l'empathie.

English: I sure miss my friends.

English: Are you sure you don't want to keep it?

English: Father showed him into the study.

English: All you have to do is smile.

English: Can you climb the tree?

English: We are looking forward to seeing you soon.
French: Nous sommes impatients de vous voir.

English: Let's go by train.

English: Tom loves to sing.
French: Tom aime chanter.

English: Tom was unshaven and disheveled.
French: Tom était mal rasé et hirsute.

English: Is everybody ready?
French: Chacun est-il prêt ?

English: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
French: Il n'y a pas de profit sans risque.

English: I've come to accept this.
French: J'ai fini par accepter cela.

English: It looks like we're running out of money.

English: He was looking for this very thing.
French: Il cherchait justement cette chose-là.

English: The car has been acting strangely.
French: La voiture s'est comportée bizarrement.

English: As soon as the new teacher entered the classroom, the students began to applaud.
French: Sitôt le nouveau professeur entré dans la classe, les étudiants commencèrent à s'agiter.

English: My car is being repaired.
French: Ma voiture est en train d'être réparée.

English: Tom doesn't need to know where I'm going.
French: Tom n'a pas besoin de savoir où je vais.

English: Bread is made from flour, water and yeast.
French: Le pain est fait avec de la farine, de l'eau et de la levure.

English: You look so beautiful.
French: Tu as l'air si belle.

English: He told me that I could use his car.
French: Il m'a dit que je pouvais utiliser sa voiture.

English: I'm not bluffing.
French: Je suis sérieux.

English: I'm sorry to bother you so often.
French: Je suis désolé de vous déranger si souvent.

English: The hole is big enough.
French: Le trou est assez large.

English: You should brush your teeth after every meal.
French: Tu devrais te brosser les dents après chaque repas.

English: I'll leave it up to you.
French: Je te laisse en décider.

English: Why was I not informed?
French: Pourquoi n'ai-je pas été informé ?

English: What happened to all that money?
French: Qu'est-il advenu de tout cet argent ?

English: Have you ever been to Africa?

English: I know exactly who it is.
French: Je sais précisément de qui il s'agit.

English: I'm assuming this is your father.
French: Je suppose qu'il s'agit de votre père.

English: I don't care who we give it to.

English: His car broke down on the way to work.
French: Sa voiture est tombée en panne en allant au travail.

English: Do you want another one of these?
French: En voulez-vous encore un ?

English: Promise me that you won't tell anybody.
French: Promets-moi que tu ne le diras à personne.

English: If it were not for exams, we would be happy.
French: N'était-ce pour les examens, nous serions contents.

English: I've fallen in love with you.
French: Je suis tombé amoureuse de toi.

English: If you leave now, you'll get there on time.
French: Si tu pars maintenant, tu y seras à l'heure.

English: He handled the tool skillfully.
French: Il manipulait l'outil avec compétence.

English: She missed him a lot.
French: Il lui manquait beaucoup.

English: I think I did well.
French: Je pense m'en être bien sortie.

English: This isn't enough.
French: Ça ne suffit pas.

English: Tom wants you to do him a favor.
French: Tom veut que vous lui fassiez une faveur.

English: You aren't going to call my parents, are you?
French: Vous n'allez pas appeler mes parents, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I thought it'd be fun to surprise Tom.
French: J'ai pensé que ce serait drôle de surprendre Tom.

English: It'll rain soon.
French: Il va pleuvoir bientôt.

English: Am I disturbing something?

English: You didn't have to leave.
French: Il n'était pas nécessaire que tu partes.

English: I suggested that we bring the meeting to an end.
French: J'ai suggéré que nous mettions fin à la réunion.

English: We felt sympathy for her.
French: Nous éprouvions de la compassion envers elle.

English: How was school today?
French: Comment s'est passée l'école, aujourd'hui ?

English: I like Tom.
French: J'aime Tom.

English: He did both at the same time.
French: Il fit les deux en même temps.

English: Tom leaned on the counter.
French: Tom se pencha sur le comptoir.

English: To be successful, you need to look like you're already successful.
French: Pour avoir du succès, il faut paraître en avoir déjà.

English: He is too smart not to know it.
French: Il est trop intelligent pour ne pas le savoir.

English: Tom told Mary that their relationship was over.
French: Tom a dit à Mary que leur relation était terminée.

English: It doesn't ring a bell.
French: Ça ne m'évoque rien.

English: You can't just not do your job.

English: The capital of Poland is Warsaw.
French: La capitale de la Pologne est Varsovie.

English: You handled that situation quite well.
French: Vous avez géré cette situation plutôt bien.

English: He is mad about music.
French: C'est un fou de musique.

English: That's my daughter.
French: C'est ma fille.

English: Am I on the wrong road?
French: Suis-je sur la mauvaise route ?

English: Tom didn't have to wait long.
French: Tom n'a pas dû attendre longtemps.

English: Can you read that sign ahead of us?

English: She lives with him.
French: Elle vit avec lui.

English: Come on! We'll be late.
French: Allez ! Nous serons en retard.

English: I'll go first.
French: Je vais y aller en premier.

English: I don't want to be involved in this affair.

English: That's of no use to me.

English: Aren't you embarrassed?

English: Would it be all right if I visited you today?

English: When her husband died, she felt like killing herself.
French: Lorsque son mari mourut, elle voulut se tuer.

English: Someone ate all the cookies.
French: Quelqu'un a mangé tous les gâteaux.

English: Did you take a shower today?

English: Tom drove us back home.

English: I'm rational.

English: Tom didn't even have enough money to buy a cup of coffee.
French: Tom n'a même pas eu assez d'argent pour un café.

English: Nobody knows what's going to happen.
French: Personne ne sait ce qui va se passer.

English: My family are all very well.

English: Don't drag me into this.

English: My passport's been stolen.

English: I got a rash on my hands from dishwasher detergent.
French: J'ai une rougeur sur les mains à cause du détergent pour lave-vaisselle.

English: I'm not convinced of that.

English: I slept only three hours.

English: Teachers should deal fairly with their students.
French: Les enseignants devraient traiter leurs élèves équitablement.

English: They're looking for you.

English: I have to leave school.

English: Spring is my favorite season.

English: You might as well throw your money away as spend it on gambling.
French: Tu ferais tout aussi bien de jeter ton argent par les fenêtres que de le dépenser au jeu.

English: They are leaving Japan tomorrow.
French: Ils quittent le Japon demain.

English: Don't make it any more difficult.

English: Did you receive an invitation?

English: Why did you paint the bench red?

English: I don't know how to spell the word.
French: Je ne sais pas comment épeler ce mot.

English: May I see your driver's license, sir?

English: That's sort of nice.
French: C'est plutôt chouette.

English: You don't know where it is, do you?

English: I don't often get invited to parties.

English: We were crowded into the small room.

English: Tom rents rooms to students.
French: Tom loue des chambres à des étudiants.

English: Are we all here?

English: Put your pants on.

English: Please leave right away.

English: Would you be willing to send me a sample free of charge?

French: Il a la réputation de prendre son temps pour prendre une décision.

English: The Sphinx began to walk around him.
French: Le sphinx se mit à marcher autour de lui.

English: Is that your sister?

English: I think that was very funny.
French: J'ai trouvé cela très drôle.

English: Do you still want to give me a hug?

English: I have misjudged you.

English: I try to travel with only one suitcase.
French: J'essaie de voyager avec une seule valise.

English: You're better off not getting in his way!

English: I'm glad I make you happy.

English: Thanks for joining us.

English: He has two cats.
French: Il a deux chats.

English: Can you come with me?

English: His words hurt her feelings.
French: Ses paroles l'ont blessée.

English: I don't always follow instructions.
French: Je ne suis pas toujours les instructions.

English: It's not that strange.
French: Ce n'est pas si étrange.

English: I'll buy a book for Tom.

English: I can't see anything from here.

English: We will get to Tokyo Station at noon.
French: Nous serons à la gare de Tokyo à midi.

English: Isn't that nice?

English: We have to give them something.

English: I'd heard you'd changed.

English: We're a team.

English: Shut up and let me think.

English: This movie is rated R.
French: Ce film est classé X.

English: You'll get there in time, as long as you don't miss the train.
French: Tu y parviendras à temps, pour autant que tu ne loupes pas le train.

English: I like all of them.
French: Je les aime tous.

English: He knows how to bet.
French: Il sait comment parier.

English: There's a garden in front of our house.
French: Notre maison est pourvue d'un jardin sur sa face avant.

English: Don't act like that.
French: N'agissez pas ainsi.

English: I had to get away from here.
French: Il m'a fallu m'extirper d'ici.

English: Why did you listen to them?

English: I heard that.
French: J'ai entendu ça.

English: I was Mr. Jackson's student.
French: J'étais l'étudiant de M. Jackson.

English: That was really important.
French: C'était vraiment important.

English: How many times have you moved?
French: Combien de fois avez-vous déménagé ?

English: I came to see Tom.
French: Je suis venu voir Tom.

English: I cringed.
French: J'ai eu un mouvement de recul.

English: I am following that car.
French: Je suis cette voiture.

English: Go straight down this street and turn right at the third light.
French: Allez tout droit dans cette rue et au troisième feu, tournez à droite.

English: You're the only person I can trust.
French: Vous êtes la seule personne en qui j'ai confiance.

English: I wish there were a better translation of this book.
French: J'aimerais qu'il y ait une meilleure traduction de ce livre.

English: She'd like him to leave right away.
French: Elle aimerait qu'il parte immédiatement.

English: We found a secret door into the building.
French: Nous avons trouvé une porte dérobée dans le bâtiment.

English: How should I know?
French: Comment le saurais-je ?

English: Can you still remember where we first met?
French: Peux-tu encore te souvenir où nous nous sommes rencontrés pour la première fois ?

English: I was a kid at that time.
French: J'étais gamin à l'époque.

English: I saw you doing that.
French: Je t'ai vu le faire.

English: I just wanted to drop by to say hi.
French: Je voulais juste passer pour la saluer.

English: You're beautiful.
French: Tu es beau.

English: Telephone him if the message is important.
French: Téléphone-lui si le message est important.

English: Please drive safely.
French: Conduis prudemment s'il te plaît.

English: I really want to study French.
French: Je veux vraiment étudier le français.

English: Don't leave your dog inside all day.
French: Ne laissez pas votre chien à l'intérieur toute la journée.

English: I was very tired, so I fell asleep right away.
French: J'étais très fatigué alors je me suis immédiatement endormi.

English: I'm just an average girl.
French: Je suis juste une fille normale.

English: I'll be happy to work with you.
French: Je serai heureux de travailler avec toi.

English: Napoleon's headquarters were in an unused windmill.
French: Le quartier général de Napoléon était dans un moulin désaffecté.

English: It's better than doing nothing.
French: C'est mieux que de ne rien faire.

English: I was framed.
French: On m'a tendu un piège.

English: I will finish this work by 5 o'clock.
French: Je vais finir ce travail à 5 h 00.

English: I was counting on you.
French: Je comptais sur toi.

English: I'm looking for a wallet.
French: Je cherche un portefeuille.

English: This computer is powerful, efficient, and easy to use.
French: Cet ordinateur est puissant, efficace et simple à utiliser.

English: I'm using that cup.
French: Je suis en train d'utiliser cette tasse.

English: I love hanging out with you.
French: J'adore être avec toi.

English: He's saving up to go to college.
French: Il économise pour pouvoir aller à l'université.

English: Am I a bad person?
French: Suis-je quelqu'un de mauvais ?

English: He told me to meet him there.
French: Il me dit de l'y rencontrer.

English: I want you out of my life.
French: Je veux que vous sortiez de ma vie.

English: I got up while it was still dark.
French: Je me levai pendant qu'il faisait encore noir.

English: I hate to waste my time.
French: Je déteste gaspiller mon temps.

English: A unicycle has only one wheel.
French: Un monocycle n'a qu'une seule roue.

English: I think we should get out here.
French: Je pense que nous devrions sortir d'ici.

English: She laid her baby on the bed.
French: Elle mit au lit son bébé.

English: I made rice.
French: J'ai fait du riz.

English: When she heard the bad news, she fainted.
French: Quand elle a entendu la mauvaise nouvelle, elle s'est évanouie.

English: I made a careless mistake.
French: J'ai commis une faute d'inattention.

English: Many restaurants now have free Wi-Fi.
French: De nombreux restaurants disposent désormais d'une connection WiFi gratuite.

English: They have enough money.
French: Ils disposent de suffisamment d'argent.

English: You gotta get more organized.
French: Il faut que tu sois davantage organisé.

English: Few students know how to read Latin.
French: Peu d'étudiants savent lire en latin.

English: I can't pay you what you're asking.
French: Je ne peux pas te payer ce que tu demandes.

English: Put a lid on it!
French: Ferme-la !

English: Autumn came and the leaves started to fall.
French: Vint l'automne et les feuilles se mirent à tomber.

English: Aren't you going to invite Tom to your party?
French: Ne vas-tu pas inviter Tom à ta fête ?

English: I don't think that's the whole story.
French: Je ne pense pas que ce soit là toute l'histoire.

English: I promise you I'll look after you.
French: Je vous promets de m'occuper de vous.

English: Tell me a bedtime story.
French: Conte-moi une histoire pour m'endormir !

English: The ship hasn't even docked yet.
French: Le navire n'est même pas encore à quai.

English: Did you recognize any of those people?
French: As-tu reconnu la moindre de ces personnes ?

English: That sounded like an explosion.
French: Cela sonnait comme une détonation.

English: They seldom, if ever, speak in French.
French: Ils parlent rarement français, si tant est qu'ils le fassent.

English: Is that a threat?
French: S'agit-il d'une menace ?

English: I can swim as well as you.
French: Je sais nager aussi bien que vous.

English: Somebody has to be held accountable for his death.
French: Quelqu'un doit porter le chapeau pour sa mort.

English: What is in the garden?
French: Qu'y a-t-il dans le jardin ?

English: Have you been playing basketball all afternoon?
French: As-tu joué au basket toute l'après-midi?

English: I'm going to Australia.
French: Je vais en Australie.

English: He's not here yet.
French: Il n'est pas encore là.

English: This is no time to be funny.
French: L'heure n'est pas à l'amusement.

English: Here is your book.
French: Voici ton livre.

English: Life is boring in a small village.
French: La vie est monotone dans un petit village.

English: Tom and Mary were worried.
French: Tom et Mary étaient inquiets.

English: Have you eaten?
French: Tu as mangé ?

English: Tom shouldn't make fun of Mary.
French: Tom ne devrait pas se moquer de Mary.

English: I may have something for you.
French: Il se peut que j'ai quelque chose pour vous.

English: I'm careful not to spend too much.
French: Je fais attention à ne pas trop dépenser.

English: Don't be unreasonable.
French: Ne sois pas déraisonnable.

English: She kept crying all night.
French: Elle a continué à pleurer toute la nuit.

English: I handled it.
French: Je m'en suis sorti.

English: I was in a better mood three hours ago.
French: J'étais de meilleure humeur il y a trois heures.

English: It's been a horrible day.
French: Ça a été une journée horrible.

English: You should stay here a few days.
French: Vous devriez rester ici quelques jours.

English: Tom does that every Monday afternoon.
French: Tom le fait tous les lundis après-midi.

English: You're not welcome here.
French: Vous n'êtes pas les bienvenus ici.

English: Come to my house at eight.
French: Viens chez moi à huit heures.

English: He repaired his watch by himself.
French: Il répara sa montre par ses propres moyens.

English: We thought you were sick.
French: Nous pensions que vous étiez malade.

English: That's a shame.
French: C'est une honte.

English: What are you inferring?
French: Que veux-tu dire par là ?

English: Why did you lend money to someone like him?

English: She disapproved of my trip to Vienna.
French: Elle a désapprouvé mon voyage à Vienne.

English: Fill out this form.
French: Remplissez ce formulaire.

English: I can't remember the secret code.
French: Je n'arrive pas à me souvenir du code secret.

English: We were younger then.
French: À cette époque, nous étions plus jeunes.

English: He was kind enough to show me the way.
French: Il fut assez aimable pour m'indiquer le chemin.

English: Are you listening closely?

English: Tom wished he could've stayed longer.
French: Tom aurait souhaité pouvoir rester plus longtemps.

English: Tom drank the whole bottle of wine by himself.
French: Tom a bu toute la bouteille de vin à lui tout seul.

English: I share a room with Tom.
French: Je partage une chambre avec Tom.

English: I'd like to talk to you when you have some free time.
French: J'aimerais te causer, lorsque tu auras du temps disponible.

English: Take whichever you like.
French: Prends ce que tu aimes.

English: By signing a contract, you agree to certain terms and conditions.
French: En signant un contrat vous souscrivez à certaines dispositions et conditions.

English: Don't you move or I'll shoot.
French: Ne bougez pas ou je tire !

English: Tom wants to work with Mary.
French: Tom veut travailler avec Mary.

English: It's not that long a flight.
French: Ce n'est pas un vol si long.

English: I can play Chopin.
French: Je peux jouer du Chopin.

English: You're creepy.
French: Tu es sinistre.

English: Fill in your name and address here.
French: Remplissez ici votre nom et adresse.

English: Sewing is manual work.
French: Coudre, c'est du travail manuel.

English: I'm going to go buy a ticket, so please watch my bags for a minute.
French: Je vais aller acheter un ticket, alors surveillez mes sacs une minute, s'il vous plaît.

English: I'm sorry I told you.
French: Je suis désolé de te l'avoir dit.

English: Arson is a criminal act.
French: Un incendie volontaire est un acte criminel.

English: Do you want to sleep on the couch?
French: Veux-tu dormir sur le canapé?

English: Tom doesn't know whether Mary will come by car or by bicycle.
French: Tom ne sait pas si Marie va venir en voiture ou en vélo.

English: We're doing well.

English: Such a proposal would only be turned down immediately.
French: Une proposition pareille ne serait que rejetée aussitôt.

English: I can't go now. I have work to do.
French: Je ne peux pas m'y rendre pour le moment. J'ai du travail à faire.

English: Sooner or later, his luck will run out.
French: Tôt ou tard, sa chance l'abandonnera.

English: You're a liar.

English: I've found the key.
French: J'ai trouvé la clé.

English: It'll never work.
French: Cela ne fonctionnera jamais.

English: I'll be there Monday night.
French: Je serai là-bas lundi soir.

English: That's actually very hard to do.
French: C'est en réalité très difficile à faire.

English: I don't think I can do this anymore.
French: Je ne pense pas arriver à faire encore ça.

English: I ate potato chips.
French: J'ai mangé des chips.

English: I do want to go with you.
French: Je veux en effet aller avec toi.

English: You should go out and have some fun.
French: Vous devriez sortir et vous amuser.

English: He owns this land.
French: Cette terre lui appartient.

English: Why not apply for that job?
French: Pourquoi ne sollicitez-vous pas cet emploi ?

English: There is no use waiting for her any longer.
French: Ça ne sert à rien de continuer à l'attendre.

English: They started dancing.
French: Ils ont commencé à danser.

English: We were proud of our strength.
French: Nous étions fiers de notre force.

English: The stock price index soared to an all-time high.
French: L'indice boursier a atteint des sommets.

English: Do you think we should abandon ship?
French: Penses-tu que nous devrions abandonner le navire ?

English: Please give me this book.
French: Donne-moi ce livre s'il te plaît.

English: You can't be sure of that.
French: Vous ne pouvez pas en être sûrs.

English: Christmas is a time for sharing.
French: Noël est un moment de partage.

English: I'm going to need you.
French: Je vais avoir besoin de toi.

English: If you add three to four, you get seven.
French: En additionnant trois et quatre, vous obtenez sept.

English: How many people were present at the meeting?
French: Combien de personnes étaient-elles présentes à la réunion ?

English: Inoue doesn't like computers.
French: Inoue n'aime pas les ordinateurs.

English: She rarely talked to anybody.
French: Elle parlait rarement à qui que ce soit.

English: Everybody made it to the wedding.
French: Tout le monde est arrivé au mariage.

English: He behaved like a child.
French: Il s'est conduit comme un gamin.

English: Tom usually gives easy-to-understand explanations.
French: Tom donne souvent des explications faciles à comprendre.

English: You made this all possible.
French: Vous avez rendu tout ceci possible.

English: I kept the seat warm for you.
French: Je vous ai gardé la place au chaud.

English: I went for a walk with my son.

English: I don't have a good feeling about this.
French: Je n'ai pas une bonne impression à ce propos.

English: I want to prove I can do this.
French: Je veux prouver que je peux le faire.

English: Tom is optimistic.
French: Tom est optimiste.

English: I knew Tom was lying to us.
French: Je savais que Tom nous mentait.

English: I'll wait until you finish the work.
French: Je vais attendre que vous finissiez votre travail.

English: I know a good Italian restaurant.
French: Je connais un bon restaurant italien.

English: Just pretend you don't know me.
French: Imagine que tu ne me connais pas.

English: It's not as easy as you think.
French: Ce n'est pas aussi facile que tu penses.

English: It was through his influence that she became interested in ecology.
French: C'est sous son influence qu'elle a commencé à s'intéresser à l'écologie.

English: I felt sorry for the boy.
French: Je me sentis désolé pour le garçon.

English: I've never liked doing that.
French: Je n'ai jamais aimé faire ça.

English: You're very sharp.
French: Vous êtes très vif.

English: Well, what does that tell you?
French: Eh bien, qu'est-ce que cela t'évoque ?

English: He looks as if he were ill.
French: Il a l'air malade.

English: She taught him how to play the piano.
French: Elle lui enseigna à jouer du piano.

English: Tom deserved to be treated with respect.
French: Tom mérita d'être traité avec respect.

English: We're shy.
French: Nous sommes timides.

English: I don't take bribes.
French: Je ne prends pas les pots de vin.

English: Where did you find the keys?
French: Où as-tu trouvé les clés ?

English: I think Tom feels the same way.
French: Je pense que Tom ressent la même chose.

English: Are these bananas ripe?
French: Ces bananes sont-elles mûres ?

English: He was expelled from school.
French: Il a été exclu de l'école.

English: I wish you did not have so many problems.
French: Je regrette que tu aies autant d'ennuis.

English: I bumped into an old friend on the bus.
French: Je suis tombé sur un vieil ami dans le bus.

English: Could you describe to the jury what happened?
French: Pourriez-vous décrire au jury ce qui s'est produit ?

English: You're supposed to help your friends when they're in trouble.
French: On est supposé aider ses amis lorsqu'ils sont dans la mouise.

English: I'd like to know how you got my phone number.
French: J'aimerais savoir comment vous avez obtenu mon numéro de téléphone.

English: It was rather difficult for me to make out what he was saying.
French: Il m'était plutôt difficile de distinguer ce qu'il disait.

English: Please bring the others.
French: Emmène les autres, je te prie.

English: We owe three years worth of taxes.
French: Nous devons trois années d'impôts.

English: It doesn't sound too bad to me.
French: Ça ne me semble pas si terrible.

English: Put your hat on.
French: Mettez votre chapeau !

English: Why didn't you stop Tom?
French: Pourquoi n'avez-vous pas arrêté Tom ?

English: Would you like to go to a movie tonight?
French: Voudrais-tu aller voir un film, ce soir ?

English: I saw you doing that.
French: Je vous ai vu faire cela.

English: Tom said that it probably wouldn't rain until evening.
French: Tom a dit qu'il ne pleuvrait probablement pas jusqu'à ce soir.

English: Moral leadership is more powerful than any weapon.
French: L'autorité morale est plus puissante que n'importe quelle arme.

English: He did not say so.
French: Ce n'est pas ce qu'il a dit.

English: Think of what you are reading while you are reading it.
French: Pense à ce que tu es en train de lire pendant que tu le lis.

English: I need more gold.
French: J'ai besoin de plus d'or.

English: There's something you have to know.
French: Il y a quelque chose que vous devez savoir.

English: If I were you, I wouldn't hesitate.
French: À ta place, je n'hésiterais pas.

English: The work must be finished before noon.
French: Le travail doit être terminé avant midi.

English: What do you plan on doing with the money?

English: I'd like to apologize for the way I handled the situation.
French: J'aimerais présenter mes excuses pour la manière dont j'ai géré la situation.

English: Do you know Tom's girlfriend's name?
French: Connaissez-vous le nom de la petite-amie de Tom ?

English: You've done enough.
French: Vous en avez fait assez.

English: I dream about Tom every night.
French: Je rêve de Tom toutes les nuits.

English: Let's go out on the balcony.
French: Sortons sur le balcon.

English: Tom can reach me at this number any time of day.
French: Tom peut me joindre à ce numéro à tout moment de la journée.

English: They have nothing against it.
French: Elles n'ont rien contre.

English: Do you want something?
French: Tu veux quelque chose ?

English: I've got to do something first.
French: Je dois faire quelque chose auparavant.

English: I can't teach you anything else.
French: Je ne peux rien vous enseigner de plus.

English: What color do you like?
French: Quelle couleur aimez-vous ?

English: You need to be more patient.
French: Il te faut être davantage patient.

English: You don't look that good.
French: Vous n'avez pas l'air aussi bons que ça.

English: My wife died three years ago.
French: Ma femme est décédée il y a trois ans.

English: We won't get off this island alive.
French: Nous ne sortirons pas vivantes de cette île.

English: Can I bring a friend?
French: Est-ce que je peux amener un ami ?

English: Do you spend most of your time worrying about things that don't matter so much?
French: Passes-tu la plupart de ton temps à te soucier de choses qui n'ont pas tant d'importance ?

English: They agreed to start early.
French: Elles se mirent d'accord pour commencer tôt.

English: I admire your work ethic.
French: J'admire votre code de conduite au travail.

English: He made good use of the money.
French: Il a fait bon usage de cet argent.

English: What will you have to do? asked her friend.
French: « Que feras-tu ? » demanda son amie.

English: I've got something better.
French: J'ai quelque chose de meilleur.

English: Are your hands clean?

English: I have not eaten any seafood since the recent oil spill.
French: Je n'ai pas mangé de fruits de mer depuis la dernière marée noire.

English: What did I miss?

English: Camping so near the river isn't a good idea.
French: Camper si près de la rivière n'est pas une bonne idée.

English: This is my bicycle.
French: C'est mon vélo.

English: I am dying to see her again.

English: I'll be right by your side.

English: I didn't see Tom yesterday.
French: Je n'ai pas vu Tom hier.

English: She recovered from her long illness.
French: Elle se remit de sa longue maladie.

English: The tree fell down.
French: L'arbre chut.

English: Not everyone needs a college degree.
French: Tout le monde n'a pas besoin d'un diplôme universitaire.

English: It's our duty.
French: C'est notre devoir.

English: We don't do this often enough.
French: Nous ne faisons pas ça assez souvent.

English: She is always smoking.
French: Elle est toujours à fumer.

English: I am saving money in order to buy a new personal computer.
French: J'économise de l'argent afin de m'acheter un nouvel ordinateur personnel.

English: I have to finish what I started.
French: Il me faut finir ce que j'ai commencé.

English: What're we waiting for?

English: I'm not going to tell you how to do that.
French: Je ne vais pas t'indiquer comment le faire.

English: Is everybody happy now?

English: You've got a great memory.

English: He can't tell what is written on the paper.
French: Il ne peut pas dire ce qui est écrit sur le papier.

English: Is that machine still usable?
French: Est-ce que cette machine est encore utilisable ?

English: Tom advised Mary not to stay out late at night.
French: Tom conseilla à Mary de ne pas rester dehors tard la nuit.

English: I was fascinated by her beauty.
French: J'étais fasciné par sa beauté.

English: That's what I got.

English: The party's over.
French: La fête est finie.

English: We found it very hard going back to our base camp in the blizzard.
French: Il nous a été très difficile de rentrer au camp de base avec le blizzard.

English: Do you want a hand?

English: Which way is the beach?

English: Do you have to work today?

English: Would you be willing to show me how to do that?

English: She took him for all his money.
French: Elle l'a nettoyé.

English: I don't want to marry you.
French: Je ne veux pas vous épouser.

English: I try to please everyone.

English: That's a beautiful song.

English: I have a visa.

English: I think you know why I can't do that.
French: Je pense que vous savez pourquoi je ne peux pas faire ça.

English: Are those for me?
French: Celles-là sont-elles pour moi ?

English: This book was very interesting.
French: Ce livre était très intéressant.

English: What's the name of that bird?
French: Comment se nomme cet oiseau ?

English: Where do you want these suitcases?

English: Tom never trusted Mary.
French: Tom n'a jamais eu confiance en Mary.

English: Tom is going through puberty.
French: Tom entre dans sa période de puberté.

English: Are scientists close to cloning a human being? "Not by a long shot."
French: «Les scientifiques sont-ils sur le point de répliquer un être humain ?» «Loin s'en faut.»

English: She took me under her wing and taught me everything she knows.
French: Elle me prit sous son aile et m'enseigna tout ce qu'elle savait.

English: The rain lasted three days.
French: La pluie a duré trois jours.

English: Please close the door.
French: Ferme la porte, je te prie.

English: May I ask you a question?

English: I knew you wouldn't want to do that.
French: Je savais que vous ne voudriez pas faire cela.

English: I'm very glad to see you again.
French: Je suis très contente de te revoir.

English: There were few, if any, trees.
French: Il n'y avait presque aucun arbre.

English: I lit the fire.
French: J'ai allumé le feu.

English: You took the words right out of my mouth.
French: Tu m'as ôté les mots de la bouche.

English: It can't hurt you.
French: Ça ne peut pas vous faire de mal.

English: My car is parked not far from here.
French: Ma voiture est garée près d'ici.

English: I became acquainted with your father yesterday.
French: J'ai fait hier la connaissance de votre père.

English: Do you like this blouse?
French: Aimez-vous ce chemisier ?

English: This is my umbrella, not Tom's.
French: C'est mon parapluie, pas celui de Tom.

English: I find that fascinating.
French: Je trouve ça captivant.

English: I can't tell you how happy I am that you've come to visit us.
French: Je ne peux pas te dire combien je suis heureux que tu sois venue nous rendre visite.

English: We want to get to know you better.
French: Nous voulons mieux vous connaître.

English: Have you considered that?
French: As-tu pensé à ça  ?

English: Aren't you interested in learning French?
French: N'es-tu pas intéressé par l'apprentissage du français ?

English: The treaty did not ban nuclear tests under the ground.
French: Le traité n'interdisait pas les tests nucléaires souterrains.

English: I like the color of your lipstick.
French: J'aime la couleur de ton rouge à lèvres.

English: I heard strange noises coming from his bedroom.
French: J'ai entendu des bruits étranges provenant de sa chambre.

English: Get up and dance with us.
French: Lève-toi et danse avec nous.

English: I was out all day.
French: J'étais dehors toute la journée.

English: We depend on foreign nations for our natural resources.
French: Nous dépendons des nations étrangères pour nos ressources naturelles.

English: They tried to cheer me up.
French: Elles essayèrent de me remonter.

English: My wife is obsessed with cleaning.
French: Ma femme est obsédée par le nettoyage.

English: I have rights.
French: J'ai des droits.

English: I hope he's wrong.
French: J'espère qu'il a tort.

English: I just haven't gotten to it yet.
French: Je n'y suis simplement pas encore parvenu.

English: I'm no different than you.
French: Je ne suis pas différente de vous.

English: I have someone I want you to meet.
French: Il y a quelqu'un que je veux que vous rencontriez.

English: I don't have time to go there today.
French: Je n'ai pas le temps de m'y rendre aujourd'hui.

English: He recommended this dictionary to me.
French: Il m'a conseillé ce dictionnaire.

English: Everyone was surprised.
French: Tout le monde a été surpris.

English: Who organized the meeting?
French: Qui a organisé la réunion ?

English: She has a natural talent for music.
French: Elle a un talent naturel pour la musique.

English: My uncle gave me his car.
French: Mon oncle me donna sa voiture.

English: We're reading.
French: Nous lisons.

English: These logs are heavy.
French: Ces journaux sont gros.

English: Your sister's sleeping.
French: Ta sœur dort.

English: I've been bitten by mosquitos all over my arm.
French: J'ai été mordu par des moustiques sur tout le bras.

English: They won't make it.
French: Elles n'y parviendront pas.

English: Don't forget to take out the garbage.
French: N'oubliez pas de sortir les ordures !

English: Our teacher looks young for her age.
French: Notre professeur paraît jeune pour son âge.

English: Death is an integral part of life.
French: La mort est une part intégrante de la vie.

English: I'll make you proud of me.
French: Je vous rendrai fier de moi.

English: Are you free now?
French: As-tu du temps, maintenant ?

English: Tom chased the thief.
French: Tom poursuivit le voleur.

English: Don't forget your sunscreen.
French: N'oubliez pas votre écran solaire !

English: How long has Tom studied French?
French: Combien de temps Tom a-t-il étudié le français ?

English: I am alarmed by your irresponsible attitude.
French: Je suis étonné par ton attitude irresponsable.

English: Turn it up.
French: Augmentez-le.

English: He has an unpronounceable name.
French: Il a un nom à coucher dehors.

English: You never told me you had a brother.
French: Vous ne m'aviez jamais dit que vous aviez un frère.

English: Tom is doing a dangerous job.
French: Tom fait un travail dangereux.

English: I don't know how far.
French: J'ignore à quelle distance.

English: That's not my concern.
French: Ce n'est pas mon problème.

English: You're the one who trained me.
French: Tu es celui qui m'a entraînée.

English: I heard the good news.
French: J'ai entendu la bonne nouvelle.

English: I knew Tom was very angry.
French: Je savais que Tom était très en colère.

English: We reached the station on time.
French: Nous sommes parvenues à la gare à temps.

English: This text isn't easy to translate.
French: Ce texte n'est pas si facile à traduire.

English: When you're right, you're right.
French: Quand tu as raison, tu as raison.

English: We have a lot to talk about.
French: Nous avons beaucoup à discuter.

English: You recognize him, don't you?
French: Vous le reconnaissez, n'est-ce pas ?

English: We can't lose sight of that.
French: Nous ne pouvons pas perdre ça de vue.

English: Tom refused to tell us anything.
French: Tom a refusé de nous dire quoi que ce soit.

English: Do you want to go?
French: Voulez-vous vous en aller ?

English: The thief ran away when she saw the policeman.
French: La voleuse s'échappa lorsqu'elle vit le policier.

English: I think that I smell smoke.
French: Je pense que cela sent la fumée.

English: I saw Tom kissing another girl.
French: Je vis Tom embrasser une autre fille.

English: I should've done this a long time ago.
French: J'aurais dû faire ça il y a longtemps.

English: This milk tastes sour.
French: Ce lait a un goût aigre.

English: It's been a while since I've studied French.
French: Ça fait un moment que je n'ai pas étudié le français.

English: There you go again.
French: Tu remets encore ça.

English: He's two years older than Mary is.
French: Il est deux ans plus vieux que Mary.

English: He is leaving Chicago tomorrow.
French: Il va quitter Chicago demain.

English: I had to walk because there were no taxis.
French: Je dus marcher car il n'y avait pas de taxis.

English: Tom should've worked harder.
French: Tom aurait dû travailler davantage.

English: Last night, I listened to radio.
French: Hier soir, j'ai écouté la radio.

English: It doesn't matter what game he plays, he always wins.
French: Le jeu auquel il joue n'a pas d'importance, il gagne toujours.

English: Why are you dressed like that?
French: Pourquoi êtes-vous habillé comme cela ?

English: After that incident, he never drank again.
French: Après cet incident, il n'a plus jamais bu.

English: I'll have it up and running in no time.
French: Je vais le mettre en route en un clin d'œil.

English: He was scared to admit that he didn't know.
French: Il avait peur d'admettre qu'il ne savait pas.

English: I hope that she will help me.
French: J'espère qu'elle m'aidera.

English: There are fifty stars on the American flag.
French: Il y a cinquante étoiles sur le drapeau américain.

English: Let's work on one project at a time.
French: Travaillons sur un seul projet à la fois.

English: Keep the change!
French: Gardez la monnaie !

English: How's your old lady doing?
French: Comment votre femme se porte-t-elle ?

English: He doesn't know me.
French: Il ne me connaît pas.

English: I'm the new teacher.
French: Je suis le nouvel enseignant.

English: If I were you, I'd go home right away.
French: Si j'étais toi, je rentrerais tout de suite.

English: I suppose I'll have to be more careful in the future.
French: Je suppose qu'il me faudra être plus prudente à l'avenir.

English: We depend on each other.
French: Nous dépendons les uns des autres.

English: I'll pay for you.
French: Je vais payer pour toi.

English: There were no fences on the great plains.
French: Il n'y avait pas de clôtures sur les grandes plaines.

English: He reads French and German, not to speak of English.
French: Il lit le français et l'allemand, sans parler de l'anglais.

English: I succeeded thanks to his advice.
French: J'ai réussi grâce à son conseil.

English: He didn't say a word to me all day.
French: Il ne m'a pas dit un mot de la journée.

English: Give me what you have in your hand.
French: Donnez-moi ce que vous avez dans la main.

English: A stranger came into the building.
French: Un étranger entra dans l'immeuble.

English: What are you staring at?
French: Que regardes-tu ?

English: I don't think they heard us.
French: Je ne pense pas qu'ils nous aient entendues.

English: It's very likely to rain tomorrow.
French: Il est fort probable qu'il pleuve demain.

English: There is nothing God cannot do.
French: À Dieu, rien d'impossible.

English: Who's to say it's not what's supposed to happen?

French: Ce n'est ni bon ni mauvais.

English: He was robbed of all his money.
French: On lui a volé tout son argent.

English: This coffee tastes bitter.

French: Une conduite prudente évite les accidents.

English: Tom's arm brushed against mine.
French: Le bras de Tom a frôlé le mien.

English: He's the one I called.

English: Do you know where he lives?

English: Is this your first trip abroad?

English: Don't let them tell you you're crazy.
French: Ne les laisse pas te dire que tu es fou.

English: We're safe.

English: I'd like to go to the zoo.

English: We have enough money to buy one more bottle of wine.
French: Nous avons assez d'argent pour acheter une bouteille de vin supplémentaire.

English: The bus will come soon.

French: Avoir devant lui plus d'un problème à la fois le rend irritable, contrarié et exaspéré.

English: Tom made me go against my will.
French: Tom m'a fait venir contre ma volonté.

English: My brother wants to go to the moon some day.
French: Mon frère veut se rendre sur la Lune, un de ces quatre.

English: I don't ride the bus to work anymore.
French: Je ne vais plus au travail en bus.

English: You're not bruised.

English: I know Tom is a bright boy.

English: I'll show you the way to the station.
French: Je vais vous montrer le chemin jusqu'à la gare.

French: Je ferai ce travail à condition d'être payé.

English: This is the worst thing I've ever done.

English: He had a new idea.

English: The rain made me late.

French: Elle a paniqué quand elle a entendu les informations.

English: Do you know something I don't know?

English: I know Tom is in.

English: You might want some of this.
French: Il se pourrait que tu veuilles une partie de ceci.

English: Which do you like better, spring or autumn?
French: Qu’est-ce que vous préférez, le printemps ou l’automne?

French: Après la partie, il s'est rendu directement chez lui pour nourrir son chien.

English: I can't afford to buy another computer.
French: Je n'ai pas les moyens d'acheter un autre ordinateur.

English: He invested a lot of money in stocks.
French: Il a investi beaucoup d'argent en actions.

English: Is this what you want?

English: What's making this sound?

English: We're not ready.

English: I don't have many friends.

English: How much did you pay?

French: Je suggère que vous n'attendiez pas plus longtemps.

English: If it happens to rain, the garden party won't be held.
French: Si la pluie survient, la fête champêtre n'aura pas lieu.

French: Elles furent victorieuses.

English: You're a wonderful friend.
French: Tu es une merveilleuse amie.

English: Tom thinks I can do it.

English: He's not the brightest guy in the world.

English: Send me a picture of yourself.

English: Tom is lucky to still be alive.

English: That's not important now.
French: Ce n'est pas important maintenant.

English: Will you take me there?

English: I ate your piece of cake.

English: I've never seen a whale that big.
French: Jamais n'ai-je vu baleine aussi grande.

English: Tom had no sooner arrived than he was asked to leave.
French: À peine Tom était-il arrivé qu'on lui demanda de partir.

English: She's afraid of the dark.
French: Elle a peur de la nuit.

English: I estimate that the work will cost more than $10,000.
French: J‘estime que le travail coûtera plus de 10 000 $.

English: I don't have the money to buy a car.
French: Je n'ai pas l'argent pour acheter une voiture.

English: It's best to put covers on paperbacks.
French: C'est mieux de couvrir les livres de poche.

English: I'm tired of keeping secrets.
French: J'en ai marre de garder des secrets.

English: I am truly sorry.

English: I want to know who told you that.

English: You're cruel.

English: Tom has finally forgiven me.
French: Tom m'a finalement pardonné.

English: He showed signs of great emotion.
French: Il montra des signes de grande émotion.

English: I don't go to school by bus.
French: Je ne me rends pas à l'école en bus.

English: Keep your room as neat as you can.
French: Tiens ta chambre aussi nette que tu peux.

English: I'll call you after lunch.

English: What do you think you'd like to do next time?

English: What do you do on Sunday?

English: He is likely to come.
French: Il va probablement venir.

English: He went to Boston by car.
French: Il est allé à Boston en voiture.

English: How do I get out of this mess?

English: I have no money with me.
French: Je n’ai pas de monnaie sur moi.

English: Do you love each other very much?

English: I didn't know that you cared.

English: They worked like bees.

English: Can you translate that into French?

English: I slept on the sofa.

English: Tom put on his backpack.

English: Can I have the paper when you're finished with it?

English: My cat got stuck up a tree.

English: Do you want anything to eat?

English: No one is asking you to eat that.

English: I hope you have brains enough to see the difference.

English: I don't have as much money as you think.

English: Flowers attract bees.

English: Is there another solution?

English: They probably saw our ship come into port.

English: I said stop.

English: We still have plenty of time left.

English: I don't know how else to explain it.

French: J'ai failli oublier de parler de la soirée à Tom.

English: I don't like this.

English: I feel kind of hungry.

English: I need some water.

English: I can't explain it to you.

English: I had a good time during the trip.

English: Tom translated the letter into French for me.

English: I'm always up early.

English: I think we have some mice in the attic.

English: We need to check this report for accuracy.

English: It doesn't look good at all.

English: No one was wearing a seatbelt.

English: What other movies did you watch?

English: I think Tom really enjoyed himself.

English: This medication works instantly.

English: Natural food will do you good.

English: Would you teach me?

French: Merci de me contacter par courrier.

English: I figured you'd be impressed.
French: Je pensais que tu serais impressionné.

English: That's what's crazy.

English: Do you want to join them?

English: I'm going to get myself some coffee. Do you want some?

English: Tom asked Mary why she was smiling.
French: Tom a demandé à Mary pourquoi elle souriait.

English: I really have missed you.

English: I just had my final exam today.

English: I would like to give him a present for his birthday.
French: Je voudrais lui offrir un cadeau pour son anniversaire.

English: Is it true that you breast-fed all your children?

English: Don't state the obvious.

English: I've remarried.

English: I grew up in a small town.

English: Am I wrong?

English: He is one of the greatest artists in Japan.
French: C'est l'un des plus grands artistes au Japon.

English: I am too tired to walk any more.
French: Je suis trop fatigué pour marcher davantage.

English: I'm sorry to have disturbed you.

English: She went in to get it.
French: Elle est entrée pour se le procurer.

English: I've never liked this.

English: Is it that obvious?

English: I don't have any objections.
French: Je n'ai aucune objection.

English: I got carded.
French: On m'a demandé ma carte d'identité pour vérifier mon âge.

English: She said that she was ill.
French: Elle a dit qu'elle était malade.

English: He's still single.

English: I'd like to visit Boston someday.
French: J'aimerais visiter Boston, un jour.

English: I think you might like it.

English: I only hope we can get this done on time.

French: Je partais de chez moi lorsque Tom m'a téléphoné.

English: This house isn't very big.
French: Cette maison n’est pas très grande.

English: Did you read what I wrote?
French: Avez-vous lu ce que j'ai écrit ?

English: How awesome is that?

English: I'm not inspired anymore.
French: Je ne suis plus inspirée.

English: I still don't understand you.
French: Je ne vous comprends toujours pas.

English: You're forgiven.

English: Will you go?

English: We must evacuate.
French: Il nous faut évacuer.

English: Is that healthy?

English: Who was the girl you were with the other day?

English: They handled it well.
French: Elles s'en sont bien occupé.

English: You're no longer welcome in my house.
French: Vous n'êtes plus le bienvenu chez moi.

English: I think we should go.
French: Je pense que nous devrions y aller.

English: Don't talk to your mother like that.
French: Ne parlez pas ainsi à votre mère !

English: He's the one who touched me.
French: C'est celui qui m'a tripoté.

English: I can't believe your parents let you come here by yourself.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que vos parents vous laissent venir ici toute seule.

English: World War One had ended just 15 years earlier.
French: La première guerre mondiale s'était terminée juste quinze ans auparavant.

English: I don't know much more than that.
French: Je n'en sais pas beaucoup plus.

English: Does truth matter?
French: La vérité importe-t-elle ?

English: No other mountain in the world is so high as Mt. Everest.
French: Aucune montagne au monde n'atteint la hauteur du Mont Everest.

English: That was harder than I thought it would be.
French: C'était plus difficile que je pensais que ce serait.

English: Mary is Tom's fiancée.
French: Marie est la fiancée de Tom.

English: I don't lend my books to any of the students.
French: Je ne prête mes livres à aucun des étudiants.

English: You don't have to lie.
French: Vous n'êtes pas forcée de mentir.

English: I knew Tom was in Boston.
French: Je savais que Tom était à Boston.

English: If you see Tom, please tell him for me.
French: Si tu vois Tom, s'il te plaît parle lui pour moi.

English: We're lost.
French: Nous sommes perdues.

English: Let's do our best.
French: Faisons de notre mieux.

English: It is impossible to do it.
French: C'est impossible à faire.

English: Farmers are busy working in the field.
French: Les agriculteurs sont occupés dans les champs.

English: We were rowing against the current.
French: Nous ramions à contre-courant.

English: I want you gone.
French: Je veux que vous partiez.

English: Having failed several times, he tried to do it again.
French: Après avoir échoué plusieurs fois, il essaya une nouvelle fois.

English: I will see to it that everything is ready in time.
French: Je veillerai à ce que tout soit prêt à temps.

English: You're the laziest person I know.
French: Tu es la personne la plus paresseuse que je connaisse.

English: Please let me know as soon as it's decided.
French: Faites-le-moi savoir dès que c'est décidé.

English: You're obnoxious.
French: Tu es odieuse.

English: My brother has been sick since yesterday.
French: Mon frère est malade depuis hier.

English: The enemy is becoming more and more powerful.
French: L'ennemi devient de plus en plus puissant.

English: Do we have time?

English: I like cooking.
French: J'aime cuisiner.

English: That should be enough for you.
French: Cela devrait suffire pour vous.

English: All of a sudden, the barn went up in flames.
French: Tout à coup, la grange s'est enflammée.

English: I'm always proud of my family.
French: Je suis toujours fier de ma famille.

English: Tom eats rice almost every day.
French: Tom mange du riz presque chaque jour.

English: I buy loads of stuff at that store.
French: J'achète des tas de trucs dans ce magasin.

English: Is it hard to fool you?
French: Est-ce difficile de te piéger ?

English: Would you open the door?
French: Pourrais-tu ouvrir la porte ?

English: She is graceful.
French: Elle est gracieuse.

English: Do you know your blood type?
French: Connais-tu ton groupe sanguin ?

English: I've heard everything.
French: J'ai tout entendu.

English: I'll see you at nine tomorrow morning.
French: Je te verrai à neuf heures demain matin.

English: Cut the cloth diagonally.
French: Coupez le tissu en diagonale.

English: You can't keep doing this, Tom.
French: Tu ne peux pas continuer comme ça, Tom.

English: I want you to tell me everything that happened.
French: Je veux que tu me dises tout ce qui s'est passé.

English: Are you finished?

English: I've lost my car key.
French: J'ai perdu ma clé de voiture.

English: The store was not a big one, was it?
French: Le magasin n'était pas grand, si ?

English: Are cats smarter than dogs?
French: Est-ce que les chats sont plus intelligents que les chiens ?

English: If it gets boring, I'll go home.
French: Si ça devient ennuyeux, j'irai chez moi.

English: I'm sure we can work this out.
French: Je suis sûre que nous pouvons résoudre cela.

English: We're all retired.
French: Nous sommes toutes retraitées.

English: Is there a doctor on board?
French: Y a-t-il un médecin à bord ?

English: I'm assuming you have a plan.
French: Je suppose que tu disposes d'un plan.

English: I'm lying.
French: Je suis en train de mentir.

English: He became sick and they laid him on a bench.
French: Il s'est trouvé mal et ils l'ont allongé sur un banc.

English: She spends a major part of her income on food.
French: Elle dépense la majeure partie de son salaire en nourriture.

English: I spent most of the day in bed.
French: J'ai passé le plus clair de la journée dans mon lit.

English: I really appreciate your offer to help me clean out my garage.
French: Je te suis vraiment reconnaissant pour ta proposition de m'aider à nettoyer mon garage.

English: I appreciate your patience.
French: Je vous suis reconnaissante pour votre patience.

English: We accept all major credit cards.
French: Nous acceptons toutes les principales cartes de crédit.

English: He kept his sense of humor until the day he died.
French: Il a conservé son sens de l'humour jusqu'au jour où il est mort.

English: Do you have a credit card?
French: Disposez-vous d'une carte de crédit ?

English: Thank you for helping me correct the situation.
French: Merci de m'avoir aidé à corriger la situation.

English: I didn't actually think you'd agree.
French: Je ne pensais vraiment pas que tu serais d'accord.

English: I think I can answer that.
French: Je pense que je peux répondre à ça.

English: Don't despise others because they are poor.
French: Ne méprisez pas les autres parce qu'ils sont pauvres.

English: The more you play, the better you'll get.
French: Plus tu joues, le meilleur tu deviens.

English: You should work in the interests of humanity.
French: Tu devrais travailler dans l'intérêt de l'humanité.

English: I'm going to stay with my uncle in Kyoto.
French: Je vais rester avec mon oncle à Kyoto.

English: I'll stay here until you return.
French: Je resterai ici jusqu'à votre retour.

English: The girl made off with her employer's money.
French: La gamine s'envola avec l'argent de son employeur.

English: Where's the toilet?
French: Où se trouvent les toilettes ?

English: It is sad that so few people give money to help the hungry.
French: Il est triste que si peu de gens donnent de l'argent pour aider les affamés.

English: I came to warn you not to do that.
French: Je suis venu t'avertir de ne pas faire ça.

English: You are the chosen one.
French: Vous êtes l'élu.

English: The teacher taught them that the earth is round.
French: L'instituteur leur a enseigné que la Terre est ronde.

English: We need to make sure that this is true.
French: Nous devons nous assurer que ceci est vrai.

English: I saw Tom kissing John's wife.
French: J'ai vu Tom embrasser la femme de John.

English: Let me off at the train station, please.
French: Largue-moi à la gare, je te prie !

English: Don't bother.
French: Ne dérangez pas.

English: Are we going somewhere?
French: Allons-nous quelque part ?

English: Cigarette smoke bothers me a lot.
French: La fumée de cigarette m'incommode beaucoup.

English: I did this for my son.
French: J'ai fait ceci pour mon fils.

English: You've still got a place to live.
French: Vous avez encore un endroit où vivre.

English: Your daughter is very pretty.
French: Ta fille est très jolie.

English: Are you two going out together?
French: Sortez-vous toutes deux ensemble ?

English: One of the children is studying, but the others are playing.
French: Un des enfants étudie, mais les autres jouent.

English: Tom was about to kiss Mary when her father walked into the room.
French: Tom était sur le point d'embrasser Mary lorsque son père est rentré dans la pièce.

English: It's illegal to buy cocaine.
French: C'est illégal d'acheter de la cocaïne.

English: No one knows me like you do.
French: Personne ne me connaît autant que vous.

English: You lied to me.
French: Tu m'as menti.

English: Tom and Mary don't seem to really talk to each other all that much.
French: On ne dirait pas que Tom et Mary se parlent tant que ça.

English: Tom and Mary aren't afraid.
French: Tom et Mary n'ont pas peur.

English: I hope that you have a good lawyer.
French: J'espère que vous avez un bon avocat.

English: Yesterday, I read a really interesting story.
French: Hier, j'ai lu une histoire vraiment intéressante.

English: I thought a walk in the park might take our minds off our troubles.
French: J'ai pensé qu'une promenade dans le parc pourrait soulager nos esprits de nos ennuis.

English: I learned nothing new.
French: Je n'ai rien appris de nouveau.

English: I learned that when I was in high school.
French: J'ai appris ça quand j'étais au lycée.

English: It is true that he won first prize.
French: C'est vrai qu'il a gagné le premier prix.

English: I'll buy you a drink.

English: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
French: Une injustice où qu'elle soit est une menace pour la justice partout.

English: What a nice tie!

English: We're finished here.
French: Nous en avons fini, ici.

English: I'm so thirsty.
French: J'ai tellement soif.

English: I saw him cross the road.
French: Je l'ai vu traverser la route.

English: You look upset.
French: Tu as l'air contrariée.

English: He cannot play guitar.
French: Il ne sait pas jouer de la guitare.

English: They took a walk.
French: Elles firent une promenade.

English: My dog sleeps under my bed.
French: Mon chien dort sous mon lit.

English: It's been a good day.
French: Ça a été une bonne journée.

English: Everybody panicked.

English: You're going to laugh.

English: This is my bicycle.
French: C'est ma bicyclette.

English: I've got to get dressed for school.
French: Il me faut m'habiller pour l'école.

English: It is terrible weather today.
French: Il fait dégueulasse aujourd'hui.

English: Dinner smells delicious.
French: Le déjeuner a une odeur délicieuse.

English: Didn't I ask you not to dance with Tom?
French: Ne t'ai-je pas dit ne pas danser avec Tom ?

English: I need it.
French: Il me le faut.

English: I'd like three tickets, please.
French: Je voudrais trois tickets s'il vous plaît.

English: I am not certain about that.
French: Je n'en suis pas sûr.

English: If everyone pitches in, we can do it.
French: Si tout le monde y met du sien, nous pouvons y arriver.

English: We listened to his lecture on the radio.
French: Nous avons écouté sa conférence à la radio.

English: Tom was fairly nervous.
French: Tom était assez nerveux.

English: I was fired without cause.
French: J'ai été renvoyée sans raison.

English: The girl let the bird go.
French: La fille laissa l'oiseau s'envoler.

English: I guess that doesn't concern me.
French: Je suppose que cela ne me regarde pas.

English: It was very beautiful.
French: C'était fort beau.

English: There are a lot of things you don't know about my personality.
French: Il y a beaucoup de choses que tu ne sais pas sur ma personnalité.

English: He's a slacker.

English: It is just five o'clock.
French: Il est pile cinq heures.

English: I know that Mary loves me.
French: Je sais que Mary m'aime.

English: Please stay at my house tonight.
French: Veuillez rester chez moi ce soir.

English: Tom had reasons to be angry.
French: Tom avait des raisons d'être en colère.

English: I have a pair of red shoes.
French: J'ai une paire de chaussures rouges.

English: Do you think you can manage to keep things going until I get back?
French: Pensez-vous pouvoir vous débrouiller pour que les choses continuent à avancer jusqu'à ce que je revienne ?

English: They're dancing.
French: Elles sont en train de danser.

English: I have an extremely tight schedule for tomorrow.
French: J'ai un programme extrêmement chargé pour demain.

English: This applies to your case as well.
French: Cela vous concerne aussi.

English: I will need your help.
French: J'aurai besoin de ton aide.

English: Are you up?

English: I want to make friends with your sister.
French: Je veux devenir ami avec votre sœur.

English: He licked his fingers.
French: Il s'est léché les doigts.

English: Tom felt invincible.
French: Tom s'est senti invincible.

English: I gave my seat to the old lady.
French: J'ai donné mon siège à la vieille dame.

English: I fell in the pool.
French: Je suis tombé dans la piscine.

English: They found each other.
French: Elles se trouvèrent.

English: We aren't here to arrest you.
French: Nous ne sommes pas ici pour t'arrêter.

English: Is there anything you want to know?
French: Y a-t-il quoi que ce soit que tu veuilles savoir ?

English: I owe my success to my friends.
French: Je dois ma réussite à mes amis.

English: This restaurant is badly managed.
French: Ce restaurant est mal géré.

English: I'd like to run a few more tests.
French: J'aimerais faire quelques examens additionnels.

English: Do you feel any better?

English: The root of a flower is as weak as a baby's finger.
French: La racine d'une fleur est aussi faible que le doigt d'un bébé.

English: We'll start whenever you are ready.
French: Nous commencerons dès que vous êtes prêt.

English: Do you trust anyone?
French: Vous fiez-vous à qui que ce soit ?

English: He let me go.
French: Il m'a laissée m'en aller.

English: That was mean.
French: C'était méchant.

English: It's not right.
French: Ce n'est pas correct.

English: I fully agree with all of you.
French: Je suis parfaitement d'accord avec vous tous.

English: Everybody needs to know this.
French: Tout le monde doit savoir ça.

English: I don't know what to do.
French: Je ne sais pas quoi faire.

English: Do you understand or not?
French: Comprenez-vous ou pas ?

English: Some babies learn to swim even before they are one year old.
French: Certains bébés apprennent à nager avant même d'avoir un an.

English: I had it all planned.
French: J'avais tout prévu.

English: He is such a show off.
French: C'est un tel frimeur !

English: This building belongs to us.
French: Ce bâtiment nous appartient.

English: I'm late for practice.
French: Je suis en retard pour l'entraînement.

English: I'd like to know the rest of the story.
French: J'aimerais connaître le reste de l'histoire.

English: I can't wait until tomorrow.
French: Je ne peux pas attendre jusqu'à demain.

English: I'd like to stay for one night.
French: J’aimerais rester pour une nuit.

English: Tom died three months ago in Australia.
French: Tom est mort il y a trois mois en Australie.

English: What's in these boxes?
French: Qu'y a-t-il dans ces boîtes ?

English: You took the cookies out of the oven too soon.
French: Tu as sorti les cookies du four trop tôt.

English: It depends on how you deal with it.
French: Cela dépend de la façon dont vous le gérez.

English: I can't promise you anything.
French: Je ne peux rien vous promettre.

English: I don't have time to do the laundry.
French: Je n'ai pas le temps de faire la lessive.

English: Summer holiday begins in July.
French: Les grandes vacances commencent en Juillet.

English: I couldn't help Tom.
French: Je ne pouvais pas aider Tom.

English: I had a hunch you would do that.
French: J'ai eu le pressentiment que vous feriez cela.

English: I am sure of his success.
French: Je suis sûre de son succès.

English: You're still young.
French: Tu es encore jeune.

English: You don't seem too surprised.
French: Tu ne sembles pas trop surprise.

English: I had a lot of money, but spent everything.
French: Je disposais de beaucoup d'argent, mais j'ai tout dépensé.

English: I'm sick of it.
French: J'en suis malade.

English: Let me think for a while.
French: Laisse-moi réfléchir un peu.

English: I own this car.
French: Je possède cette voiture.

English: I'd never seen Tom cry before.
French: Je n'avais jamais vu Tom pleurer avant.

English: I need 30 more days to pay.
French: J'ai besoin de trente jours de plus pour payer.

English: My driving instructor says I should be more patient.
French: Mon moniteur d’auto-école dit que je devrais être plus patient.

English: Women feel that men are often very complicated.
French: Les femmes trouvent que les hommes sont souvent très compliqués.

English: I gave you fair warning.
French: Je vous ai suffisamment avertis.

English: I meet people like you every day.
French: Je rencontre des gens comme vous tous les jours.

English: I took care of that for you.
French: Je m'en suis occupé pour toi.

English: Even without makeup, she's very cute.
French: Même sans maquillage elle est super mignonne.

English: I have something urgent to attend to.
French: J'ai quelque chose d'urgent auquel je dois assister.

English: I would like to see my father.
French: J'aimerais voir mon père.

English: We must not retreat.
French: Nous ne devons pas battre en retraite.

English: I sent him a letter to let him know my decision.
French: Je lui ai envoyé une lettre pour lui faire savoir ma décision.

English: Did she mention the results of the exam?
French: A-t-elle parlé des résultats de l'examen ?

English: That can't be Mary. She's in the hospital now.
French: Ce n'est pas Marie car elle est à l’hôpital.

English: In a town with only one barber, who shaves the barber?
French: Dans une ville avec un seul barbier, qui rase le barbier ?

English: It's on its way.
French: C'est en cours.

English: I won a prize in the spelling competition.
French: J'ai gagné un prix à la compétition d'orthographe.

English: It's not always possible to eat well when you're traveling in this part of the world.
French: Il n'est pas toujours possible de bien manger lorsqu'on voyage dans cette partie du monde.

English: Be polite to everyone.
French: Soyez poli avec tout le monde !

English: Tom gave something to Mary.
French: Tom a donné quelque chose à Mary.

English: The moment she was alone, she opened the letter.
French: Au moment où elle était seule, elle ouvrit la lettre.

English: We painted the walls white.
French: Nous avons peint les murs en blanc.

English: They slept in the same bed.
French: Elles dormirent dans le même lit.

English: She raced him down the hill.
French: Elle fit la course avec lui jusqu'au bas de la colline.

English: I know that I can do more.
French: Je sais que je peux faire plus.

English: I couldn't prevent Tom from leaving.
French: Je n'ai pu empêcher Tom de partir.

English: The event made him famous.
French: Cet événement l'a rendu célèbre.

English: Tom wants a new car.
French: Tom veut une nouvelle voiture.

English: I was tired so I went to bed.
French: J'étais fatiguée, je suis donc allé au lit.

English: Why were you so busy yesterday?
French: Pourquoi étiez-vous si occupée hier ?

English: I'd like to thank you.
French: J'aimerais te remercier.

English: You're the only one for me now.
French: Tu es la seule pour moi désormais.

English: You shouldn't have borrowed Tom's car.
French: Tu n'aurais pas dû emprunter la voiture de Tom.

English: I had business to take care of.
French: Il a fallu que je m'occupe d'une affaire.

English: Tom seems jealous.
French: Tom semble jaloux.

English: Tom hid himself under the table.
French: Tom se cacha en dessous de la table.

English: My dog is dreaming of a cat.
French: Ma chienne rêve d'un chat.

English: I just finished.
French: Je viens de terminer.

English: I prefer this version.
French: Je préfère cette version.

English: Turtles are reptiles.
French: Les tortues sont des reptiles.

English: Stay away from my motorcycle.
French: Reste loin de ma moto.

English: The divorce was finalized this morning at the attorney's office.
French: Le divorce a finalement été prononcé ce matin au bureau du juge.

English: This sounds like French.
French: On dirait du français.

English: Settle down for a while and concentrate.
French: Pose-toi un instant.

English: Keep on smiling.
French: Restez souriants.

English: I haven't heard of it.
French: Je n'en ai pas entendu parler.

English: Which do you prefer, apples or bananas?
French: Qu'est-ce-que tu préfères, les pommes ou les bananes ?

English: Do you have a vacancy?
French: Est-ce que vous avez des chambres de libre ?

English: He is no longer a child.
French: Ce n'est plus un enfant.

English: May I speak to the lady of the house?
French: Puis-je parler à la dame de la maison?

English: I didn't want to surprise you.
French: Je ne voulais pas vous surprendre.

English: That's one of mine.
French: Il s'agit de l'un des miens.

English: You're very funny.
French: Vous êtes très drôle.

English: Come and see me.
French: Venez me voir.

English: That's all I know.
French: C'est tout ce que je sais.

English: You are drunk!
French: Tu es bourré !

English: This is kind of fun.
French: C'est plutôt marrant.

English: Keep driving.
French: Continue à rouler !

English: The referee made the right decision.
French: L'arbitre a pris la bonne décision.

English: I want to know who gave that to you.
French: Je veux savoir qui vous a donné cela.

English: Maybe we can talk about that later.
French: Peut-être pouvons-nous en parler plus tard.

English: I found the leak.
French: J'ai trouvé la fuite.

English: Who's your teacher?

English: I'm one of the thirty people who had to do that.
French: Je suis l'une des trente personnes qui devaient le faire.

English: The boy took off his clothes and put on his pajamas.
French: Le garçon se déshabilla puis enfila son pyjama.

English: They released the prisoner.
French: Ils ont relâché le prisonnier.

English: We won't be able to evade punishment this time.
French: Nous ne pourrons pas échapper à la sanction cette fois-ci.

English: You're fair.
French: Tu es juste.

English: I wonder why this is happening.
French: Je me demande pourquoi cela se produit.

English: Obviously, there's a problem.
French: Manifestement, il y a un problème.

English: Please move your bicycle out of here.
French: Bougez votre vélo de là, s'il vous plaît !

English: She is trying to lose weight.
French: Elle essaie de perdre du poids.

English: It's all downhill from here.
French: Ça ne fait que descendre, à partir d'ici.

English: Look at that mountain.
French: Regardez cette montagne.

English: What scared you?
French: Qu'est-ce qui vous a effrayés ?

English: She is dieting.
French: Elle est au régime.

English: He's three years older than she is.
French: Il est plus vieux qu'elle de 3 ans.

English: You know I'm wrong.
French: Tu sais que j'ai tort.

English: I hesitate to broach the subject with her.
French: J'hésite à mettre le sujet sur la table avec elle.

English: She told me that I could sleep on the sofa.
French: Elle me dit que je pouvais dormir sur le canapé.

English: If you had made more effort, you would have passed the entrance examination.
French: Si tu avais fait plus d'efforts, tu aurais eu ton examen d'entrée.

English: I was puzzled about what to do next.
French: J'étais désorienté quant à savoir quoi faire par la suite.

English: They supported his right to speak freely.
French: Ils ont soutenu son droit à parler librement.

English: They trusted you.
French: Ils t'ont fait confiance.

English: When did you notice that?
